item.title: Veronica's story
item.description: 20 year old boxer Veronica describes the many traumatic experiences that she has been through and testifies of her love for God and the strength she receives from Him.

item.title: Jayden's Story
item.description: After being less active for many years, Jayden finds the courage to come back. He has found that institute can help him as he parpares for serving a mission.

item.title: Aric's Story
item.description: After returning home from a mission in Brazil Aric wanted to continue to apply himself to the gospel. Attending institute allowed him to socialize with others who share his beliefs and standards.

item.title: Riley's Story
item.description: Riley compares her love of dirt bikes with the challenges of life and testifies of the importance of institute in her life.

item.title: Aaron's Story
item.description: Musician Aaron finds support while attending institute through seeing others who have also gained testimonies. It has also helped him find answers to life’s questions.

item.title: Teina's Story
item.description: Teina expresses his love of music and rugby. Setting goals to be active in church activities helped him to transition to post mission life.

item.title: Ataahua's Story
item.description: Ataahua's talks about her reasons for preparing for a mission and her concern for those living without the knowledge of the gospel.

item.title: Tahei's Story
item.description: After illness caused her to return home from her mission in the Ukraine, Tahei struggled with who she was as a daughter of God. Finishing her mission brought understanding and peace.

item.title: Sarah's Story
item.description: YSA Representative Sarah describes the challenges and responsibilities of leading the other YSA in her area. She has seen a difference in the members since they have been attending institute.

item.title: Grace's Story
item.description: Grace expresses her appreciation for music and testifies that during our trials we should turn to the Lord.

item.title: Whatahoro's Story
item.description: Whatahoro shares his feelings on family and experience with inactivity in the church. He felt the spirit return to his life after acting on a prompting to return to church.

item.title: Ariadna's Story
item.description: After returning home from a mission in Barcelona Spain, Ariadna wanted to know what was next for her to do. Through prayer she felt that institute was the place for her.

item.title: Jaqueline's Story
item.description: Living with just her mother in a town with very few members Jaqueline questioned the truthfulness of the church. Attending seminary brought her the answers she needed.

item.title: Alfredo's Story
item.description: Attending seminary confirmed to Alfredo that Jesus Christ lives. After returning home from his mission he felt the need to attend institute in order to keep the Savior in his life.

item.title: Laura's Story
item.description: After realizing that she may have taken her seminary experience for granted Laura wanted to find what she has been missing. Once on her own she realized that her testimony wasn’t as strong as she would like.

item.title: Elder Ramirez's Story
item.description: While serving in Barcelona Spain Elder Ramirez shares his experience of being inactive in his youth and his testimony of repentance.

item.title: Institute Is For Me
item.description: Students from all walks of life come together to study. Institute is unifying, guiding, uplifting, strengthening, relevant, christ-centered.

item.description: The Atonement of Jesus Christ makes eternal progression possible.

item.description: Prophets, seers, and revelators forewarn us of dangers we cannot see.

item.description: (D&C 20) The Church of Jesus Christ is restored to the earth in 1830.

item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales recounts an experience in which his father taught him about putting on the armor of God.

item.description: We can all receive personal revelation. However, only those who are called to a presiding office can receive revelation for the Church.

item.description: The Lord loves us and wants us to understand His willingness to forgive sins.

item.title: "An Elect Lady"
item.description: (D&C 25:2-3) Video portraying events in the life of Emma Smith.

item.description: Faced with great pain and loss, a teen and his friends in Canada turn to God to find answers to their souls’ deepest questions.

item.description: President Thomas S. Monson announced that the eligible age for young men to serve missions is 18 and the eligible age for young women to serve is 19.

item.title: Eternal Life Requires Effort
item.description: Our goal is to enjoy eternal life with Heavenly Father. We must consistently make righteous choices to achieve this.

item.title: The Lord Will Help Us
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson testifies that we can accept callings because the Lord will help us do His work.

item.title: Prepare Yourself Now
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley challenged young men to begin preparing themselves now for missionary service later.

item.title: The Lord Helps Us Share the Gospel
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard relates how a sister in France shares the gospel with those around her.

item.title: The Lord Speaks through the Scriptures
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales testifies that we will hear the Lord’s voice as we study the scriptures. The scriptures are our spiritual lifeline.

item.description: Missionaries from around the world share their testimonies of blessings received from choosing to serve a mission.

item.title: Jesus Christ Is the Way
item.description: Our Heavenly Father sent His Son, Jesus Christ, to be our Savior and show us the way to live according to God's plan.

item.title: An Answer to Prayer
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles relates a miraculous event that came about because of sincere prayer.

item.title: Commit to Righteousness
item.description: Elder Donald L. Hallstrom explains that to be true disciples we must receive and obey the Lord’s law.

item.title: Stay within the Lines
item.description: Just as athletes must stay within lines to compete in sports, those who are called to labor in the Lord's work must stay within the lines of worthiness.

item.title: Receiving Revelation
item.description: You can receive personal revelation from God by living His gospel and having the gift of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: A Priesthood Duty
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson speaks to young people about missionary service—a duty for young men and a rewarding option for young women.

item.title: He Lives: Testimonies of Jesus Christ
item.description: See and hear modern-day Apostles testify that Jesus Christ is the Savior and that He lives today.

item.title: Obedience to the Prophets
item.description: In the sixth article of faith, we declare that we believe in prophets. To believe means to have faith and confidence in them and to follow and do what the prophets ask us to do.

item.title: Avoid Pornography
item.description: We must do all we can to avoid pornography. It impairs relationships, causes addition, and leads to destruction.

item.title: Everyone Can Teach
item.description: When we learn a few fundamental principles about teaching and are shown how to teach, all of us can do it.

item.title: What Is Discipleship?
item.description: Discipleship includes keeping all of the commandments and forsaking that which is not good for us. Its rewards are peace in this life and eternal life in the world to come.

item.title: Inviting the Companionship of the Holy Ghost

item.title: Jesus Christ Is our Advocate
item.description: Jesus Christ is our advocate with Heavenly Father. We can approach God in prayer and the Savior will plead our cause.

item.title: The Miracle of the Atonement
item.description: When we repent, we access the Atonement. We can be forgiven. The healing and redemptive power of the Atonement is available to each of us—always.

item.title: We Have Every Reason to Rejoice
item.description: We do not need to live in fear of the future. If we follow the promptings of the Spirit, we will be safe.

item.title: Home and Family - Through Small Things
item.description: Challenged by their bishop, three youth learn what it takes to make their home a holy place.

item.title: They that are Wise
item.description: (D&C 45:56-57) This video depicts the parable of the ten virgins, through which the Savior helps the disciples understand why and how to prepare for His Second Coming. Also included are examples of latter-day youth as they trim their spiritual lamps.

item.title: Be Not Troubled
item.description: (D&C 45:16-39) The Savior's parable of the fig tree teaches that we need not be frightened or troubled by the calamities that will come in the last days .

item.title: O Remember, Remember
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring encourages us to look for the hand of God and recognize the abundant blessings God gives to us daily.

item.title: Receiving Inspiration
item.description: Learning to recognize and hear the voice of the Spirit is an individual process that we must go through for ourselves.

item.title: Monkey Traps
item.description: Elder Backman shares a story about a monkey caught in a trap and then likens the lessons to us.

item.title: Personal Worship
item.description: Elder Goaslind helps us understand that worshiping the Lord is our personal responsibility. If we allow ourselves to experience the spirit of worship our life can change.

item.title: Spiritual Patterns
item.description: The Lord uses patterns and principles to help us return back to Him.

item.title: I’m Jason Smyth and I’m a Mormon
item.description: Four time Paralympic gold medalist Jason Smyth may have limited vision, but he never lets challenges limit what he can accomplish. He know his talents are blessing from God. www.mormon.org/jasons

item.title: I'm Lindsey Stirling and I'm a Mormon
item.description: What do modern dance, classical violin, and techno music have in common? The answer is a spunky Mormon performer with a talent for multi-tasking! See how she does it at www.mormon.org/lindsey.

item.title: The Lord’s Tender Mercies
item.description: The Lord’s tender mercies occur to help us recognize His hand in our lives

item.title: Approaching Zion
item.description: We need to understand that as much virtue can be gained in progressing toward Zion as in dwelling there. It is a process as well as a destination.

item.title: We Can Build Zion
item.description: We can build our own Zion by living according to the principles of the celestial kingdom.

item.title: Sacrifice for Temple Blessings
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson relates the sacrifices made by the Mou Tham family to receive the blessings of the temple.

item.title: Go to the Temple Often
item.description: In the temple we find peace. Our dedication to the gospel is renewed and we are strengthened in our determination to keep the commandments.

item.title: Not Being Compelled in All Things
item.description: Elder Donald L. Hallstrom describes how he learned as a youth to not be a “slothful” servant.

item.title: Knowing We Have Been Forgiven
item.description: After we repent, the Holy Ghost will testify to us that we have been forgiven.

item.title: Keeping Commandments 100% of the Time
item.description: A young man’s decision to keep the Sabbath day holy led to lifelong blessings.

item.title: Our Observance of the Sabbath
item.description: Our observance of the Sabbath day shows our attitude toward Jesus Christ’s sacrifice for us.

item.title: Share Truth with Others
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches how we can easily discuss our faith with others. Sharing testimony can impact others for eternity.

item.title: Direct Your Thoughts in Wholesome Paths
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks warns of the dangers of viewing pornography and allowing ourselves to think unwholesome thoughts.

item.title: Forgiveness: My Burden Was Made Light
item.description: Forgiveness and the power of Jesus Christ enable a man to survive losing his wife and several children in a car accident—and allow the offending driver to begin rebuilding his own life.

item.title: Forgiving Others
item.description: Elder David E. Sorensen of the Seventy teaches that when we forgive others, we open ourselves to a better future.

item.title: Faithful and Obedient
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson relates an account of Walter Krause, a German Latter-day Saint who was faithful and obedient to the Lord’s commands.

item.title: The Heart and a Willing Mind
item.description: (D&C 64:34) Elder Heber C. Kimball and his family willingly serve the Lord as Elder Kimball leaves first from Kirtland and then from Nauvoo to preach the gospel in England.

item.title: We Need Not Fear the Future
item.description: The Lord will stand by His Church and people and keep them in safety until His coming.

item.title: Miracles Can Occur
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson invites Church members to pray and exercise faith that we can share the gospel message in all areas of the world.

item.title: The Church Will Follow Its Appointed Course
item.description: Some have stumbled because of mistakes made by men. But in spite of this, the eternal truth of the restored gospel found in The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is not tarnished, diminished, or destroyed.

item.title: Continue in Patience
item.description: Patience requires that we obey God's commandments and faithfully wait for His will to be fulfilled.

item.title: Heavenly Father Knows You
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf testifies that Heavenly Father hears us and loves us because we are His children

item.title: Defend Your Beliefs
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland encourages us to defend our beliefs courteously and compassionately.

item.title: Responding to Accusers
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales testifies that the Spirit will help us know how to respond to accusers if we invite the Spirit of the Lord.

item.title: Helping Others Understand the Truth
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales testifies that questions and criticisms give us an opportunity to reach out to others and demonstrate that they matter to our Heavenly Father and to us.

item.title: You Are Called of God
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring testifies that the Lord knows you. He knows whom He would have serve in every position in His Church. He chose you.

item.title: Little Children Are Innocent
item.description: Elder Shayne M. Bowen describes the peace a woman felt to learn that her infant son who died did not need baptism to be saved.

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 22: Gordon B. Hinckley: Man of Integrity, 15th President of the Church
item.description: A Portrayal of President Gordan B. Hinckley who struggled at the start of his mission from Gordon B. Hinckley: Man of Integrity, 15th President of the Church

item.title: Our Eternal Life
item.description: We are eternal beings. We lived as spirits before we were born and we will continue to live after we die.

item.title: Giving Place in Your Heart for the Word of God
item.description: Elder D. Todd Christofferson provides instruction on how to effectively study scriptures.

item.title: Those Who Inherit the Celestial Kingdom
item.description: We must be valiant in our testimony of Jesus Christ to receive the blessings of the celestial kingdom.

item.title: Valiant in the Testimony of Jesus
item.description: Elder Bruce R. McConkie discusses the meaning of being valiant in the testimony of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Three Degrees of Glory
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains that the three different degrees of glory have a special relationship to the three different members of the Godhead.

item.title: Judged by Works and Desires
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson explains that our judgment is not by chance. The kingdom of glory we receive is the result of our works and our desires.

item.title: Becoming What Heavenly Father Desires
item.description: The final judgment is not just an evaluation of a sum total of good and evil acts—what we have done. It is an acknowledgment of the final effect of our acts and thoughts—what we have become.

item.title: Succor, Lift, and Strengthen
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard relates an experience that shows how caring for each other can help us reach our full potential.

item.title: Counselors
item.description: Counselors assist presidents. They have the responsibility to share their opinions, but then to support whatever decision the president makes.

item.title: “Strengthen the Feeble Knees”
item.description: Elder Marvin J. Ashton explains the meaning of Doctrine and Covenants 81:5

item.title: Much is Required
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen explains why Latter-day Saints are expected to follow a higher standard as they show their love for the Lord.

item.title: The Power of Godliness in Ordinances
item.description: Elder Octavio Tenorio describes how his family was sealed together through the power of the priesthood.

item.title: Patterns of Light: The Light of Christ
item.description: What is light? In this three part series, Elder David A. Bednar discusses how we receive and perceive light from God. Part 1 centers on the properties of light and how the Light of Christ affects all men and women everywhere. View Part 2, Patterns of Light: Discerning Light View Part 3, Patterns of Light: Spirit of Revelation

item.title: A Lifetime Pursuit
item.description: President Ezra Taft Benson testifies of the importance of building a testimony on the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Treasuring Up the Book of Mormon in our Hearts
item.description: President Ezra Taft Benson encourages Church members to not take the Book of Mormon lightly.

item.title: The Abrahamic Covenant
item.description: The Book of Mormon teaches that the Abrahamic covenant will be fulfilled in the latter days. It also emphasizes that we are among the covenant people of the Lord.

item.title: Stand in Holy Places and Be Not Moved
item.description: Sister Elaine Dalton relates the story of Kristina, a young woman who joined the Church in Denmark, and encourages youth today to stand in holy places and be not moved.

item.title: The Healing Power of Forgiveness
item.description: President James E. Faust testifies of the healing power of following the Savior’s counsel to “forgive all men” (D&C 64:10).

item.title: Sharing the Light of Christ
item.description: Meet Brandon Jackson, who shared his time and love with orphans in Honduras and discovered what one teenage boy can do for others.

item.title: Light and Truth, Part 1
item.description: This video examines God's attributes of light and truth as explained in section 88 of the Doctrine and Covenants (D&C 88:6-13).

item.title: He Will Draw Near to Us
item.description: Heavenly Father has given us the gospel, which teaches the way of the disciple. It teaches us the things we must know, do, and be to walk in His light, following in the footsteps of His Beloved Son, our Savior.

item.title: For Your Eternal Good
item.description: At times it is difficult to recognize what is best or expedient for you over time. Your life will be easier when you accept that what God does in your life is for your eternal good.

item.title: You Matter
item.description: God sees you as His child. He sees you as the being you are capable and designed to become. He wants you to know that you matter to Him.

item.title: The Blessings of Participation
item.description: Participation by all class members allows the Holy Ghost to enter into the heart of each learner and teach important principles.

item.title: A Brand New Year: Physical health
item.description: The Lord has commanded us to take good care of our bodies. This involves eating nutritious food, exercising regularly, and getting enough sleep. In this video, youth from around the world talk about staying healthy and obeying the Word of Wisdom.

item.title: Evil Men Conspire
item.description: Satan and his emissaries will strive to entice us to use harmful substances, because they know if we partake, our spiritual powers will be inhibited and we will be in their evil power.

item.title: The Word of Wisdom and Revelation
item.description: The Word of Wisdom blesses us spiritually as well as physically.

item.title: He Will Be There for Us
item.description: Heavenly Father has assured us that He will provide help if we ask.

item.title: Worshipping the Lord
item.description: We worship the Lord when we follow Him, obey His commandments, and strive to be like Him.

item.title: Light and Truth, Part 2
item.description: This video examines God's attributes of light and truth as explained in section 88 of the Doctrine and Covenants (D&C 93:28,36-40).

item.title: Being Diligent and Concerned at Home
item.description: Expressing love, bearing testimony, and being consistent in living the gospel are ways to be “more diligent and concerned at home.”

item.title: Power through Temple Ordinances
item.description: Power through Temple Ordinances Description: Worthiness to hold a temple recommend gives us the strength to keep our temple covenants. From keeping these covenants, we receive power to face the challenges of life.

item.title: The Crowning Blessings of Church Membership
item.description: We have not received all the blessings of the gospel until we make receive the ordinances of the temple.

item.title: Standards: Education - The Glory of God Is Intelligence
item.description: Seeking learning is a lifelong pursuit and one that increases our ability to serve the Lord.

item.title: Seeing the Savior
item.description: “Seeing” the Savior includes coming to know and understand Him. It is not limited to eyesight alone.

item.title: Latter-day Martyrs
item.description: James E. Faust relates the circumstances surrounding the martyrdom of Rafael Monroy and Vicente Morales.

item.title: The Savor of Men
item.description: When the Lord used the expression ‘savor of men,’ He was speaking of those who represent Him.

item.title: Finding Forgiveness in Our Hearts
item.description: If we can find forgiveness in our hearts for those who have caused us hurt and injury, we will rise to a higher level of self-esteem and well-being.

item.title: We Must Forgive
item.description: The experience of Corrie ten Boom illustrates how we can feel the love of God when we forgive.

item.title: The Savior Removes Guilt
item.description: Through the Atonement of Jesus Christ we can be forgiven of our sins.

item.title: Preparing for the Second Coming
item.description: We prepare ourselves for the Savior’s return as we “stand … in holy places.”

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Professional Rugby Player, and Missionary
item.description: At age 19, Will Hopoate is a professional rugby player. He will soon be a Mormon missionary and sees it as a chance to thank God for his blessings. View Will’s video portrait at www.mormon.org/william.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Optimist, and Wounded Soldier
item.description: Calling home after his injury in Iraq was hard for Erick Lund, but the terrors of war made this Mormon grateful for his family, the soldiers who carried him to safety, and his wife's socks. More at www.mormon.org/erick

item.title: Helping People Help Themselves
item.description: The Lord’s way of caring for the poor consists of teaching correct principles so they can lift themselves from poverty to self-reliance.

item.title: Beware of Murmuring
item.description: We must beware of murmuring against the Lord’s commandments because murmuring can lead to disobedience.

item.title: Caring for the Needy
item.description: The Lord’s way of caring for the needy is different from the world’s way.

item.title: Establishing Zion
item.description: We need to adopt the character, attributes, and faithfulness of those who lived in Zion if we are to establish Zion in our homes, branches, wards, and stakes.

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Barrister, and I’m Grateful for Trials
item.description: After scoliosis altered Mormon Lola Ogunbote’s dreams, she had to learn how to focus on the positive in her life. Now she can say that adversity is the backbone of her success. www.mormon.org/lola

item.title: The Aaronic Priesthood and the Ministering of Angels
item.description: The ordinances of the Aaronic priesthood are vital to the ministering of angels.

item.title: Succession in the First Presidency
item.description: By divine design, when the President of the Church dies, the First Presidency is dissolved and the Quorum of the Twelve automatically becomes the presiding body of the Church.

item.title: Sustaining Those Who Serve
item.description: For us to sustain those who have been called, we must examine our lives, repent as necessary, pledge to keep the Lord’s commandments, and follow His servants.

item.title: The Lord Measures the Heart
item.description: Ultimately we will be judged not only for our actions, but also for the desires of our hearts.

item.title: Patriarchal Blessings—A Personal Liahona
item.description: A patriarchal blessing literally contains chapters from your book of eternal possibilities.

item.title: God’s Promise to the Humble
item.description: God’s promise to the humble is that He will lead them by the hand.

item.title: Humility
item.description: Humility directs our attention and love toward others and to Heavenly Father’s purposes. Pride does the opposite.

item.title: Obtaining Revelation
item.description: We can seek divine guidance to help us through our challenges.

item.title: Authority that Binds
item.description: As members of Christ’s restored Church, we have the covenant responsibility to search out our ancestors and provide for them the saving ordinances of the gospel.

item.title: Elijah Brought the Sealing Power
item.description: Elijah was a great prophet who bestowed the sealing power upon the Prophet Joseph Smith in the Kirtland Temple. This fulfilled Malachi’s prophecy.

item.title: The Blessings of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob
item.description: Elias brought back the Abrahamic covenant, allowing us to receive all the blessings Abraham had.

item.title: Power from Covenants
item.description: Our covenant commitments to God open the way for us to feel the power of godliness.

item.title: Ordinary Latter-day Saints
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer describes how he felt as he witnessed the power of faith in the lives of a family in the Philippines.

item.title: Do The Best We Can
item.description: Oliver Granger is remembered for what he was more than for what he accomplished.

item.title: The Importance of a Name
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard explains how the name of the Church describes what the Church is.

item.title: Light in Their Eyes
item.description: Because of a young woman’s goodness, an older woman’s life was changed.

item.title: Your Witness of the Prophet Joseph Smith
item.description: A personal testimony of the Prophet Joseph Smith will prepare you to help others who are seeking the truth.

item.title: The Prophet of the Restoration
item.description: Joseph Smith was the instrument in God’s hands in bringing forth sacred scripture, lost doctrine, and the restoration of the priesthood.

item.title: Arise
item.description: 2012 Strength of Youth Music video.

item.title: Jesus Christ Understands Our Suffering
item.description: The Savior understands our suffering because of His suffering to accomplish the Atonement. Our difficult experiences can also help increase understanding and compassion for others.

item.title: Enduring Testing
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales recounts experiences of waiting upon the Lord as he learned lessons through physical pain, mental anguish, and pondering.

item.title: Our Hardest Times Bring Growth and Happiness
item.description: Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin relates how his mother taught him to respond to adversity.

item.title: Called and Chosen
item.description: Priesthood holders must live righteously to be chosen by God.

item.title: "The Powers of Heaven"
item.description: (D&C 121:34-46) The components and processes involved in providing electricity to a home are compared to the principles the Lord outlined in section 121 for those who would exercise His priesthood in power.

item.title: An Instrument in His Hands
item.description: By doing small and simple things, a young woman prepares herself to respond to any prompting to bless others.

item.title: Finding the Incredible: What Cancer and Trials Can Teach Us
item.description: Daniel and Melanie Hedlund found out Daniel had cancer in December 2007, three weeks after being married.

item.title: Why Mormons Build Temples
item.description: Throughout history, the Lord has commanded His people to build temples. Temples are literally houses of the Lord. They are holy places of worship where individuals make sacred promises with God.

item.title: Joy in Families
item.description: The greatest joys in this life center in families, as they will in the worlds to come.

item.title: Angels Are God’s Emissaries
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland describes the purpose and the ministry of angels.

item.title: For All Eternity
item.description: Elder Enrique Falabella describes the sacrifices he and his wife made to be married for eternity.

item.title: Love of Learning
item.description: Learning all we can is a necessary part of our life on earth.

item.title: Knowledge of God and Jesus Christ
item.description: We need to know about Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ to be saved.

item.title: Enduring Love
item.description: Watch how this couple demonstrates pure love and service in their marriage—even though they have to endure debilitating physical adversity.

item.title: How Do I Love Thee?
item.description: Elder Holland gives a powerful talk about how you can better show love for your friends, family, dates or spouse by following the example of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Mankind’s Three Great Rights
item.description: We believe that governments should allow citizens rights of life, liberty, and property.

item.title: Joseph and Hyrum’s Testimony of the Book of Mormon
item.description: Joseph and Hyrum Smith’s actions in Carthage Jail provide a testimony of the truthfulness of the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Our Responsibility Toward Government
item.description: We are commanded to uphold wise leaders and use our influence in the process of making and administering laws.

item.title: You Are Needed in the Lord’s Service
item.description: The spreading of the gospel throughout the earth is a sign of the coming of the Lord. You are needed in His service.

item.title: We Can Live the Lord’s Standards
item.description: We can resist the wickedness that surrounds us and become like those who lived in Zion.

item.title: Help Prepare for the Second Coming
item.description: The world is being prepared for the Second Coming because of the Lord’s work through His missionaries.

item.title: Joseph Smith—Prophet of the Restoration
item.description: (D&C 135) This review of the Prophet Joseph Smith's ministry shows that he "has done more, save Jesus only, for the salvation of men in this world."

item.title: Faithful Handcart Children
item.description: President James E. Faust relates the account of Bodil Mortensen and James Kirkwood, children in the Willie Handcart Company who died while faithfully fulfilling their tasks.

item.title: Our Mission of Saving
item.description: We must reach out to strengthen and save those in our families, our wards and stakes, and our neighborhoods and communities.

item.title: Edifying Words
item.description: The Lord has said that the words we speak should lift and build those around us.

item.title: From Manaus to São Paulo
item.description: Faithful saints make a great sacrifice to receive the blessings of the temple.

item.title: The President of the Church
item.description: The senior Apostle becomes President of the Church when the First Presidency is reorganized.

item.title: Endowed with Power
item.description: A dramatization of President Brigham Young speaking about the Saints receiving temple ordinances before leaving Nauvoo. President Howard W. Hunter and others speak of the blessing of participating in temple ordinances.

item.title: Inviting the Holy Ghost
item.description: Elder Bednar helps us understand how to invite the Holy Ghost into our daily lives.

item.title: The Pure Love of Jesus Christ
item.description: The love of God is demonstrated as we serve those around us.

item.title: Using the Messaging System
item.description: How to send and receive messages through the online site.

item.title: Teach and Learn by the Spirit
item.description: Tips on how to learn by the spirit during online seminary courses.

item.title: Explain, Share, Testify
item.description: Increased participation in online seminary allows for the Spirit to more fully instruct seminary students.

item.title: Student Example: Explain
item.description: An example of how an online student explains what the scriptures mean, and how they apply to our lives.

item.title: Cultivate an Online Seminary Learning Environment
item.description: Ideas on how to make the most out of your online seminary experience and interact with the class and teacher.

item.description: How to use class discussions in online seminary.

item.description: This video gives a brief introduction to the different time periods of Church history.

item.title: Introducing Online Seminary: Priesthood Leaders
item.description: This video is to help priesthood leaders understand what should be considered when deciding whether or not to offer online seminary classes in their area.

item.title: Introducing Online Seminary: Parents and Students

item.title: Returning to Live with Heavenly Father
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry teaches that every principle and ordinance of the gospel prepares us to return to live with Heavenly Father.

item.title: The Power of Memorizing Scriptures
item.description: Elder Richard G. Scott teaches that scriptures we memorize are like friends who can help in time of need.

item.title: Hold Fast
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland encourages us to hold fast to what we already know.

item.title: Who We Are
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf speaks about who we really are.

item.title: We Are Everything to God
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf recounts the vision of Moses and speaks of the magnificence of God's creations.

item.title: The First Commandment
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks of the commandment to have children.

item.title: Repentance Is a Blessing to All of Us
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen speaks of the need to humbly and sincerely follow the promptings to repent.

item.title: The Lord’s Law of Chastity is Clear
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen reads and comments on a statement from the First Presidency defining the Law of Chastity.

item.title: Marriage is Sacred
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson shares an analogy illustrating the sacred nature of eternal marriage.

item.title: Fulfillment of Righteous Desires
item.description: Those who do not marry in this life will have the desires of their hearts fulfilled in eternity If they have hope, exercise faith, and joyfully endure to the end.

item.title: Refrain from Anger
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson recounts the tragedy of brothers who held a grudge against each other for 62 years.

item.title: Envy
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland explains the nature and pitfalls of envy.

item.title: Establishing Zion
item.description: We need to adopt the character, attributes, and faithfulness of those who lived in Zion if we are to establish Zion in our homes, branches, wards, and stakes.

item.title: Keeping Commandments 100% of the Time
item.description: A young man’s decision to keep the Sabbath day holy led to lifelong blessings.

item.title: Daily Bread: Pattern
item.description: Just as we need daily physical sustenance, the need for daily spiritual sustenance is just as strong. We can remember Jesus Christ every day as we pray, read the scriptures, and meditate.

item.title: Having His Spirit with Us
item.description: We should attend to and learn from the choices and influences that separate us from the Holy Spirit.

item.title: Blessing Those in Need
item.description: The Lord has provided was for His disciples to help the poor and needy.

item.title: Take Heed to Thyself
item.description: When we have been blessed by God, we must remember the source of those blessings.

item.title: Choices about the Sabbath Day
item.description: We must never deviate from our greatest desire, which is to achieve eternal life.

item.title: Following Your Leaders
item.description: The Lord reveals His will to the leaders He has chosen.

item.title: Acquiring Spiritual Guidance
item.description: Elder Scott teaches how we can access divine help from Heavenly Father.

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: President Monson expresses appreciation to all members for their service in callings.

item.title: "That Night My Family Had Sufficient"
item.description: A pioneer woman trusted in God and received a miracle as a result.

item.title: False Prophets Among Us
item.description: (2 Peter 2:1-3) President Gordon B. Hinckley speaks of opposition in all things. (Ensign, May 1994, 60.)

item.title: Accepting the Will of God
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles recounts an experience of a father praying for his critically ill daughter.

item.title: Medical Science, Prayer, and Priesthood Blessings
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles explains the balance in relying on medical science, prayer, and priesthood blessings to help heal the human body.

item.title: Your Trust in the Lord
item.description: Trusting in the Lord more than your personal experience will help you through life's challenges.

item.title: The Singing of Hymns
item.description: Singing hymns invites the Spirit of the Lord.

item.title: Acquainted with the Voice
item.description: An experience as a young man helped Elder Allan F. Packer understand the importance of recognizing the voice of the Spirit.

item.title: Seeing Life from an Eternal Perspective

item.description: (Moses 2:1) Elder Maxwell testifies that Christ is the creator of our world and our savior.

item.description: Highlight: Elder Russell M. Nelson’s address at the April 2015 General Conference.

item.description: Followers of Jesus Christ describe how He has touched their lives.

item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen speaks of the need to humbly and sincerely follow the promptings to repent.

item.description: Prophets, seers, and revelators forewarn us of dangers we cannot see.

item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf testifies that Heavenly Father hears us and loves us because we are His children

item.description: (John 8:33-59) James E. Faust speaks about the Seed of Abraham.

item.title: Stay within the Lines

item.description: Patience requires that we obey God's commandments and faithfully wait for His will to be fulfilled.

item.description: After a trial of her faith, a young woman receives a witness that Heavenly Father truly does answer prayers.

item.description: (Genesis 17) The Lord appears to Abraham and covenants with him.

item.description: Faith in Jesus Christ gives us strength to leave the past behind and look ahead to a brighter future.

item.description: (Genesis 22:1-18) A video of Abraham offering his son Isaac as a sacrifice unto the Lord.

item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson shares an analogy illustrating the sacred nature of eternal marriage.

item.title: Fulfillment of Righteous Desires
item.description: Those who do not marry in this life will have the desires of their hearts fulfilled in eternity If they have hope, exercise faith, and joyfully endure to the end.

item.description: This music video emphasizes the beauty and importance of the temple.

item.description: President Thomas S. Monson recounts the tragedy of brothers who held a grudge against each other for 62 years.

item.title: Envy
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland explains the nature and pitfalls of envy.

item.description: Six interfaith youth speak candidly on why they have chosen to be sexually pure.

item.description: (JST, Genesis 50) Joseph Smith is prepared to bring to pass the restoration of the Gospel.

item.description: A young man’s decision to keep the Sabbath day holy led to lifelong blessings.

item.description: This video shows how a little girl's prayers that her family would be sealed in the temple were answered.

item.description: The sacrament is an ordinance in which Church members partake of bread and water in remembrance of the sacrifice of Jesus Christ. Through this ordinance, Church members renew the covenants they made with God when they were baptized.

item.description: Elder Gong gives six suggestions for how we can better fulfill our covenant to always remember the Savior.

By understanding the symbolism of animal sacrifice in the Old Testament, we come to realize its similarity to the sacrament—to remember the Savior and to commit ourselves to him.

item.description: When the Laie Hawaii Temple reopened after two years of renovations, youth from several islands gathered to celebrate and show their gratitude.

item.title: Return to Virtue

item.title: A “Mother” Heart
item.description: (Luke 1:38) Sister Beck helps women understand what it means to develop a disposition to mother. An excerpt from “A ‘Mother Heart,’” Ensign or Liahona, May 2004.

item.title: What Matters Most
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson counsels us to spend time with, cherish, and express love to the people we hold dear.

item.title: Seeing Life from an Eternal Perspective
item.description: Seeing life from an eternal perspective helps us focus on things that matter most.

item.title: Look to the Light
item.description: At Christmastime and always, Jesus Christ is the Light of the World for all who seek Him.

item.title: Why Does God Give us Commandments?
item.description: Have you ever wondered why God gives us commandments? It can feel restricting, but is that the reality?

item.title: By Small and Simple Things: Sharing the Gospel

item.title: Line upon Line
item.description: (2 Nephi 28:30) Elder David A. Bednar teaches that our spiritual development should be “line upon line”.

item.description: (Acts 28:1-10) Elder Richard G. Scott discusses how to pass through life's trials willingly by trusting in the Lord. ("Finding Joy in Life," Ensign, May 1996, 24-26)

item.description: (D&C 138:18-37) Elder Nelson teaches that the dead waited the Atonement.

item.description: Through the Atonement of Jesus Christ, all can be transformed, cleansed, and freed from addiction.

item.title: I’ll Go Where You Want Me to Go
item.description: A video presentation portraying member missionary work.

item.title: Isaiah Prophesied of Christ
item.description: (Isaiah 53) A video telling of Isaiah's writings of the Savior.

item.title: The Savior Wants to Forgive
item.description: A former addict and repeat convict shares his experiences with the Savior’s ability and willingness to forgive him again and again, even when he felt undeserving.

item.title: “Is Not This the Fast That I Have Chosen?”
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring

item.title: Wherefore Have We Fasted
item.description: (Isaiah 58) A young man recounts a lesson learned from his youth.

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: President Monson expresses appreciation to all members for their service in callings.

item.title: No Regrets
item.description: A young man from California decided between surfing and seminary—and never looked back.

item.title: Keeping The Sabbath
item.description: (Mark 2:23-28) President Gordon B. Hinckley teaches the importance of keeping the Sabbath day holy.

item.title: Meet Troy
item.description: Troy faces the reality of his addiction to pornography. Through honesty, repentance, and the healing power of the Atonement of Jesus Christ, he finds peace. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Which Way Do You Face?
item.description: Highlight of Elder Lynn G. Robbins's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: LDS Addiction Recovery Program: Meet Karen
item.description: Karen was a nurse, student, and mother who became addicted to pain medications. The Addiction Recovery Program helped her regain control of her life and develop a new relationship with Jesus Christ.

item.title: Watchman on the Tower
item.description: (Ezekiel 33:1-7) The Lord calls prophets to be the "watchmen" on the tower.

item.title: Sharing Your Light
item.description: A young woman from the Philippines shares her faith and hope in knowing that by setting a good example, those around her can return to following the Savior.

item.title: The Challenge to Become
item.description: The Challenge to Become

item.title: A Change of Heart
item.description: A young man in Honduras was drifting toward a life of apathy, selfishness, and trouble until a friend showed him he was born for so much more.

item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland testifies of the truth of the Bible, the Book of Mormon, and continuing revelation from God to His children.

item.description: Highlight: President Thomas S. Monson's address at the April 2015 General Conference.

item.description: March 2, 2008: Sister Julie B. Beck discusses how we can access and attain the blessings promised to Abraham and his seed.

item.title: The Gospel Shall Roll Forth
item.description: A visual depiction of Church growth by stakes (D&C 65).

item.description: One boy’s crusade to encourage clean language has far-reaching effects.

item.description: (Amos 3:7) A video depicting how God has spoken to his prophets.

item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf counsels us that when it comes to hating, gossiping, ignoring, ridiculing, holding grudges, or wanting to cause harm—stop it!

item.title: Strive
item.description: It is time to give everything we have to becoming the people God hopes we will choose to become. Join the worldwide movement to strive for the best by developing your talents, loving others, seeking education, and serving the Lord.s

item.title: After the Storm
item.description: The day of the tornado, Maylene was ready to give up on a life that had completely overwhelmed her. She felt helpless. But after surviving the tornado that day, Maylene knew that she and her family could make it through anything with God’s help.

item.title: Why Mormons Build Temples

item.description: Daughters of God support and love one another as they live covenant-centered lives.

item.title: Heavenly Father Knows Me
item.description: After a trial of her faith, a young woman receives a witness that Heavenly Father truly does answer prayers.

item.title: With All Your Heart
item.description: One young man overcomes his fears while magnifying his calling.

item.title: Bullied No More
item.description: Quote given by Brother David L. Beck in the Priesthood session on April 6, 2013.

item.title: A Standing Law unto the Church
item.description: (D&C 119:3-7) President Hinckley tells a story of a woman who sacrificed to pay tithing.

item.title: By the Hand of Elijah the Prophet
item.description: Elder Quentin L. Cook testifies of the mission of the prophet Elijah. The salvation of the whole human family is interdependent and interconnected—like the roots and branches of a great tree.

item.title: Now I'm Converted
item.description: This video shows how the youth in one stake were blessed as they responded to Elder Bednar's invitation to participate in family history.

item.title: An Apostle's Invitation

item.description: Elder Ballard teaches a group of seminary students about the importance of baptism and the authority of the priesthood.

item.description: His basketball dreams almost didn’t come true, but then Tyler Haws learned where hard work and dedication can lead.

item.title: No Regrets
item.description: A young man from California decided between surfing and seminary—and never looked back.

item.title: “Lord, Is It I?”
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Judging Others? Stop It!
item.description: Statement by President Dieter F. Uchtdorf in the Sunday morning session on April 1, 2012.

item.title: Looking through Windows

item.title: Look to the Light
item.description: At Christmastime and always, Jesus Christ is the Light of the World for all who seek Him.

item.title: The Gospel Shall Roll Forth
item.description: A visual depiction of Church growth by stakes (D&C 65).

item.title: The Sower
item.description: (Matthew 13) A miniature New Testament character teaches a young man how to understand parables.

item.title: Forgive Every One Their Trespasses: The Parable of the Unmerciful Servant
item.description: The parable of the unmerciful servant to help students understand the doctrine taught in Doctrine and Covenants 64:2-13.

item.title: Including Me
item.description: This video shows how a little girl's prayers that her family would be sealed in the temple were answered.

item.description: Use blogging, texting, and other forms of communication to share your testimony of the gospel to all the world.

item.title: Christ's Authority is Questioned
item.description: Christ's authority is questioned by the chief priests and elders. He relates the parable of the two sons to them. Matthew 21:23-32

item.description: November 7, 2010: Elder M. Russell Ballard teaches how to remain clean from the world through obedience to the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.description: Jesus is tried before Caiaphas and the chief priests. Peter denies knowing Him and weeps bitterly. Matthew 26:57-75

item.title: None Were with Him
item.description: One of the great consolations of this Easter season is that because Jesus walked such a long, lonely path utterly alone, we do not have to do so.

item.description: The Savior's body is taken by Joseph of Arimathea to a garden tomb. Angels appear and remove the stone from the front of the tomb. Mary and other women visit the empty tomb. Matthew 27:57-60

item.description: (Matthew 28:6) President Hinckley speaks about the Resurrection from the Tomb of Joseph of Arimathea. An excerpt from "Special Witnesses of Christ,” Ensign, Apr. 2001.

item.title: Sweep the Earth as with a Flood – Highlight
item.description: Highlights from Elder David A. Bednar's address at the BYU Education Week Devotional 2014.

item.description: Youth share their testimonies of the Savior.

item.description: Jesus demonstrates His divine power by healing a possessed man. Luke 4:33-37

item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.description: Elder Shayne M. Bowen teaches: "The Atonement of Jesus Christ is available to each of us. It can clean, reclaim, and sanctify even you."

item.description: Jesus shows that He has power to both forgive sins and heal physical infirmities. Mark 2:1-12

item.description: Family history is one of the many things we can do to observe and find delight on the Sabbath day.

item.description: A former addict and repeat convict shares his experiences with the Savior’s ability and willingness to forgive him again and again, even when he felt undeserving.

item.description: Jesus demonstrates His divine power by raising a young girl from the dead. Mark 5:22-24, 35-43

item.description: The disciples' faith is tested before Jesus calms the stormy sea. Mark 4:37-40

item.description: Jesus heals a woman's illness when she, in faith, touches His clothing. Mark 5:22-43

item.description: Jesus provides a meal for 5,000 people with only five loaves of bread and two fishes. Matthew 14:13-21

item.description: John's life may have been very different had he not had the courage to leave a party one evening in Japan.

item.description: A group of young women showed their love by doing for a friend what she could not do for herself.

item.title: The Widow's Mite
item.description: We asked kids to tell us the story of the widow’s mite in their own words.

item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland bears his testimony of the Atonement of the Savior.

item.title: Lesson 25: New Testament Customs—Olive Press

item.title: The Nativity
item.description: (Luke 2) This presentation depicts the account of Jesus's birth.

item.description: We asked kids to tell us about the birth of Jesus in their own words.

item.title: Fan
item.description: One of sixteen short video segments help us understand New Testament customs.

item.title: Jesus Forgives Sins and Heals a Man Stricken with Palsy
item.description: Jesus shows that He has power to both forgive sins and heal physical infirmities. Mark 2:1-12

item.title: Lifting Burdens
item.description: Apostles of Jesus Christ testify of the Savior's power to heal, change, and purify us through His Atonement.

item.description: Jesus raises the son of the widow of Nain from death. Luke 7:11-16

item.description: Refugees who fled from violence in Syria to peace in Lebanon are still facing serious challenges. There are no jobs for the adults and no schools for the children. Many are going without daily necessities.

item.title: Come unto Me
item.description: Student interviews and experiences from the life of the Savior emphasize why we should come unto Him.

item.title: The Good Samaritan
item.description: Jesus tells the parable of the good Samaritan to illustrate the commandment to "love thy neighbour as thyself." This New Testament video can enrich your preparation for Sunday School.

item.title: Parable of the Good Samaritan
item.description: A depiction of the Savior's parable of the good Samaritan, in which a man is robbed and beaten by thieves, and a Samaritan shows mercy on him. Luke 10:25-37

item.title: No Regrets
item.description: A young man from California decided between surfing and seminary—and never looked back.

item.title: Prayer
item.description: Learn from a humble woman's example how the power of prayer can work miracles in our lives.

item.title: Gordon Hinckley: Lessons I Learned as a Boy
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley recalls a story of an older boy and his young companion as they find an old coat and a badly worn pair of shoes by the roadside.

item.title: The Prodigal Son
item.description: Jesus tells the parable of the prodigal son. Luke 15:11-32

item.title: The 10th Leper
item.description: Elder Ballard teaches a group of seminary students about the 10 lepers and the lessons it teaches us about gratitude.

item.title: None Were with Him
item.description: One of the great consolations of this Easter season is that because Jesus walked such a long, lonely path utterly alone, we do not have to do so.

item.title: The Savior Suffers in Gethsemane
item.description: Jesus, Peter, James, and John retire to the Garden of Gethsemane. Jesus submits to the Father's will and begins to suffer for the sins and afflictions of mankind. He is then betrayed and arrested. Matthew 26:36-57

item.title: Jesus Is Laid in a Tomb
item.description: The Savior's body is taken by Joseph of Arimathea to a garden tomb. Angels appear and remove the stone from the front of the tomb. Mary and other women visit the empty tomb. Matthew 27:57-60

item.title: Christ Appears on the Road to Emmaus
item.description: The resurrected Christ walks with two men on the road to Emmaus. He blesses and breaks bread with them, and then vanishes from sight. Their hearts burned within them. Luke 24:13-33

item.title: Reflecting God's Love—What Scriptures Mean to Me
item.description: A seasoned leader discusses the role of the scriptures in his personal life and callings over the years as he strives to reflect the love God has for his children.

item.title: Sunday Will Come
item.description: Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin speaks on the Resurrection of the the Savior Jesus Christ, reminding those who search and plead for rest from their trials that "Sunday will come."

item.title: Heavenly Things
item.description: (John 3:12) (John 3) This presentation depicts the Savior teaching a Nicodemus of "heavenly things".

item.title: Something Different About Us: Example
item.description: Luis sets an example for his friend who is not a member of the Church. He said of fulfilling his duties of the Aaronic Priesthood, “I’m representing Jesus Christ, and that’s amazing."

item.title: Life after War and Overcoming Post-traumatic Stress
item.description: The Taylor brothers have always been close, but enduring war, posttraumatic stress, and heroin addiction together brought them closer to each other and closer to Jesus Christ than they ever imagined possible.

item.title: Daily Bread: Change
item.description: Jesus Christ is the bread of eternal life. By following Him, remembering Him, and having faith in Him we can change and become what we aspire to become.

item.title: The Woman at the Well
item.description: (John 4) This presentation depicts the Savior teaching a Samaritan woman that He is the source of living water.

item.title: Go and Sin No More
item.description: Jesus teaches about compassion when confronted with a woman accused of adultery. John 8:2-11

item.title: Jesus Heals a Man Born Blind
item.description: On the Sabbath day, Jesus heals a man born blind. John 9:1-41

item.title: Lazarus is Raised from the Dead
item.description: Jesus testifies that He is the resurrection and the life. He raises Lazarus from the dead that His disciples may believe. John 11:1-44

item.title: Unselfish Service
item.description: The Savior has taught us to follow His example and serve others.

item.title: Comfort in Trials
item.description: The Holy Spirit can provide comfort during difficult trials and challenges.

item.title: Abide in Me
item.description: (John 15:4–5) An excerpt from “Abide in Me,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2004.

item.title: I Was a Stranger: Love One Another
item.description: Helping a young refugee from the Ivory Coast leads to a blessed friendship for two women. For more information about how to help refugees, visit the “I Was a Stranger” website.

item.title: God Will Lift Us Up
item.description: Rather than focus on her medical condition, Brittany has found comfort in serving others and trusting in the Lord.

item.title: To This End Was I Born
item.description: (Matthew 26-28) This segment depicts the concluding hours of the Savior's mortal ministry.

item.title: Blessed Are They That Have Not Seen, and Yet Have Believed
item.description: Thomas, one of the twelve, doubts the appearance of the risen Lord. Christ appears, and tells him, “Blessed are those who have not seen, and yet have believed.” John 20:24-29

item.title: Feed My Sheep
item.description: Jesus shows Himself to His disciples and implores Peter to feed His sheep. John 21:1-22

category.title: Book of Mormon - Welcome to Seminary

item.title: ﻿A Message to Students of the Book of Mormon
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson speaks to seminary students about the Book of Mormon.

item.description: (1 Nephi 5:10-22) Elder Robert D. Hales speaks about searching the scriptures .

item.description: A seminary class in Samoa learns that seeking revelation requires effort and action.

item.description: (1 Nephi 16:16-32) Elder David A. Bednar talks about how the Book of Mormon can be our own Liahona.

item.description: Give thanks for the Lord Jesus Christ: His life, His atoning sacrifice, and His resurrection. John 3:16

item.description: (2 Nephi 10:6–8) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about the scattering and gathering of Israel.

item.title: Afflictions Can Be For Our Good
item.description: (D&C 98:1-3,11-22) Elder Oaks teaches that afflictions can be for our good.

item.title: Where Justice, Love, and Mercy Meet

item.title: "An Elect Lady"
