item.title: Emma Smith Follows the Lord's Counsel
item.description: (D&C 25) Emma Smith follows the counsel of the Lord.

item.title: Moments That Matter Most
item.description: We would do well to slow down a little, focus on the significant, lift up our eyes, and truly see the things that matter most.

item.title: The Song of the Heart
item.description: Marissa, a young woman from Hawaii, loves music not only because singing and dancing are her passion but also because music has led her closer to Heavenly Father.

item.title: Sacrament Worship
item.description: The ordinance of the sacrament makes the sacrament meeting the most sacred and important meeting in the Church. When we partake of the sacrament, we make a sacred covenant that we will always remember the Savior.

item.title: The Last Supper
item.description: Meeting in an upper room with His disciples, Jesus washes their feet, institutes the sacrament, and commands them to love one another. John 13:1-35

item.title: Put on the Whole Armor of God
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales recounts an experience in which his father taught him about putting on the armor of God.

item.title: Take Upon You My Whole Armor
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks teaches about the Taking on the whole armor of God (D&C 27:15-18).

item.title: God Reveals His Secrets
item.description: (Amos 3:7) A video depicting how God has spoken to his prophets.

item.title: Revelation Follows Lines of Authority
item.description: Elder Perry explains that there is order to the Lord’s revelations, and so it is that one in a position of authority may receive revelation for those under him. Revelations from God are to come through the First Presidency.

item.title: Personal Revelation
item.description: Personal revelation is the way Heavenly Father helps us know Him and His Son, learn and live the gospel, endure to the end in righteousness, and qualify for eternal life.

item.title: Revelation Comes in an Orderly Way
item.description: We can all receive personal revelation. However, only those who are called to a presiding office can receive revelation for the Church.

item.title: The Scattering and Gathering Is First Spiritual
item.description: (2 Nephi 10:6–8) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about the scattering and gathering of Israel.

item.title: Men's Hearts Shall Fail Them
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson shares a personal story to give encouragement for when we feel "weak in the heart."

item.title: Physical and Spiritual Death
item.description: (2 Nephi 9:6–24) Elder Russell M. Nelson teaches about physical and spiritual death in the plan of happiness.

item.title: Leave the Party
item.description: John's life may have been very different had he not had the courage to leave a party one evening in Japan.

item.title: If We Put God First
item.description: A young woman facing adversity shares how she was strengthened by setting aside the things of the world and putting God first.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Professional Rugby Player, and Missionary
item.description: At age 19, Will Hopoate is a professional rugby player. He will soon be a Mormon missionary and sees it as a chance to thank God for his blessings. View Will’s video portrait at www.mormon.org/william.

item.title: Your Day for a Mission
item.description: At 19, Sid Going was a shoo-in for New Zealand's national rugby team, but he chose to serve a mission first. Elder Neil L. Andersen tells why Sid made the decision and how the blessings of a mission outweigh any sacrifice.

item.title: Sharing the Gospel
item.description: Elder Cook advises members to become more active in sharing the Gospel with those around them. He tells us that if we do share with others, we will be blessed.

item.title: We Rejoice in Christ
item.description: Members share the gospel as they live it joyfully and invite others to come and participate.

item.title: By Small and Simple Things: Sharing the Gospel
item.description: Emma invited a friend to dinner, and this small act led to the friend’s conversion.

item.title: 2.1 Do I Teach the Gospel by the Spirit of Truth?
item.description: President Uctdorf emphasizes that without the spirit, no eternal learning can take place. (Dieter F. Ucthdorf, "A Teacher of God's Children," Address to Religious Educators, Jan 28, 2011.)

item.title: Faith Precedes the Miracle
item.description: President Monson teaches that faith precedes the miracle (D&C 35:8-11).

item.title: God Helps Ordinary People
item.description: (Judges 6-7) President Faust relates the story of Gideon from the Bible, explaining that the Lord can do remarkable things through a person with ordinary faith.

item.title: The Lord Will Help Us
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson testifies that we can accept callings because the Lord will help us do His work.

item.title: Rise To Your Call
item.description: President Eyring describes the significance, blessings, and impact of your calling.

item.title: The Importance of Covenants
item.description: (Alma 53:10–21) Elder M. Russell Ballard talks about the difference between living by convenience and living by covenants. Living and keeping covenants brings spiritual power.

item.title: Stay within the Lines
item.description: Just as athletes must stay within lines to compete in sports, those who are called to labor in the Lord's work must stay within the lines of worthiness.

item.title: A Priesthood Duty
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson speaks to young people about missionary service—a duty for young men and a rewarding option for young women.

item.title: Including Me
item.description: This video shows how a little girl's prayers that her family would be sealed in the temple were answered.

item.title: Will We Be Willing?
item.description: Statement by President Thomas S. Monson in the priesthood session on March 31, 2012.

item.title: Stand Up Boldly
item.description: Statement by Adrián Ochoa in the priesthood session on March 31, 2012.

item.title: Enemy Territory
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer shares an experience in which he was protected during World War II by listening to a prompting from the Spirit and promises youth that they will be protected if they "heed the promptings that come from the Holy Ghost."

item.title: The Golden Rule
item.description: (3 Nephi 14:12) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how the golden rule encompasses the moral code.

item.title: Being One with God and Christ
item.description: (John 17:11, 20–23) By submitting to the Father, Jesus Christ achieved perfect unity. An excerpt from “That They May Be One in Us,” Ensign, Nov. 2002.

item.title: See Others as They May Become
item.description: Quote given by President Thomas S. Monson in the Priesthood session on October 6, 2012.

item.title: Gather in Stakes
item.description: The Lord has commanded us to gather in stakes (D&C 101:20-22,63-75).

item.title: We Come Together & Unite As One
item.description: As much as our differences enrich our collective experience, the Gospel of Jesus Christ transcends them all.

item.title: Jesus Declares He Is the Messiah
item.description: Jesus announces that He is the Messiah prophesied by Isaiah, but is rejected by His neighbors in Nazareth. Luke 4:15-30

item.title: Jesus Declares, "I Am the Light of the World, the Truth Shall Make You Free"
item.description: Jesus declares that He is the light of the world, and the Son of God. Whosoever will embrace His gospel and follow Him can be freed from sin. John 8:12-58

item.title: Things of the World
item.description: (Genesis 13:1-13) Elder Scott teaches to eliminate distractions from our lives.

item.title: Worldly Pleasures
item.description: (Ecclesiastes 1-2) Elder Perry encourages church members to seek of the things of the spirit and not those of the world.

item.title: The Heart and a Willing Mind
item.description: (D&C 64:34) Elder Heber C. Kimball and his family willingly serve the Lord as Elder Kimball leaves first from Kirtland and then from Nauvoo to preach the gospel in England.

item.title: Joseph Smith: The Prophet of the Restoration (DVD Release)
item.description: A motion picture about the life and legacy of Joseph Smith, the founding prophet of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: God’s Laws Bless His Children
item.description: (3 Nephi 15:1–10) Elder L. Tom Perry testifies that God’s laws govern and bless His children. (“We Believe All That God Has Revealed,” Ensign, Nov. 2003, 85–88.)

item.title: Price Of Discipleship
item.description: (Luke 14:25-33) President James E. Faust speaks about the price of discipleship.

item.title: Qualifications for Bishops
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley lists the qualities and attributes of successful bishops.

item.title: The Importance of Teaching in the Gospel, part 1
item.description: Brother Russell T. Osguthorpe, Sunday School general president, interviews Elder David A. Bednar of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles.

item.title: 4.2 When Teachers and Students Join in Prayer and Faith
item.description: President Eyring shares an experience he had while teaching a class that illustrates the powerful spiritual experiences teachers and students can have in class when they are all prepared (Henry B. Eyring, "To Know and to Love God," Feb. 26, 2010).

item.title: Quorum Brotherhood
item.description: A quorum rallies around a young man who attended scouting activities for years. With their help, he comes to a knowledge of the truthfulness of the restored gospel, and is ordained to the Aaronic priesthood.

item.title: Watch Your Step
item.description: See how a moment’s decision can have far-reaching consequences—for good or bad.

item.title: Caring for the Poor and Needy
item.description: A brief overview of how The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints cares for and teaches self-reliance to the poor and needy through its Welfare program and fast offering donations.

item.title: Sacrifice
item.description: Our lives of service and sacrifice are the most appropriate expressions of our commitment to serve the Master and our fellowmen.

item.title: They Gave Up Their Christmas
item.description: Just as the wise men of old gave the Christ child gifts, members of a congregation in California offer service in a vineyard on Christmas day.

item.title: Healing the Sick
item.description: (Mark 6:5, 13; 7:32) Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks of the principle of anointings for Priesthood blessings. An excerpt from “Healing the Sick,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2010.

item.title: Jesus Heals a Woman of Faith
item.description: Jesus heals a woman's illness when she, in faith, touches His clothing. Mark 5:22-43

item.title: We Can Live With God Again
item.description: Our lives will not end when we die. Our future lives are determined by the way we live our lives now.

item.title: If We Are Well Prepared, Death Brings No Terror
item.description: (Alma 28:12–14) Elder Russell M. Nelson teaches what soothes the sting and sadness caused by the death of a loved one.

item.title: Blessings of Following Prophets
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry teaches obedience to the prophet yields blessings (Jeremiah 27-28).

item.title: The Second Coming Segment 2
item.description: Three general conference excerpts address modern-day issues concerning the Second Coming of the Savior. Segment 2 - Elder Boyd K. Packer. 2 Thessalonians 1:1-2:3

item.title: We Act
item.description: If the youth are going to become converted, they can't just listen. They have to act on what they're learning.

item.title: Come with Us
item.description: Youth from around the world share what this year's theme means to them and what they are doing to “Come unto Christ.”

item.title: Prepare Today for the Second Coming
item.description: (Joseph Smith—Matthew 1:46–54; Matthew 24:42–51) An excerpt from “Preparation for the Second Coming,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2004, 8–9.

item.title: Jesus was God The Creator
item.description: (John 1:1-3) President Gordon B. Hinckley speaks of the beautiful creations of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Jesus Christ Will Be Our Final Judge
item.description: (John 5:22, 27, 30) Elder Scott declares that the Atonement makes it possible for Jesus Christ to be our final judge. An excerpt from “The Atonement Can Secure Your Peace and Happiness,” Ensign and Liahona, Nov. 2006.

item.title: Be Not Troubled
item.description: (D&C 45:16-39) The Savior's parable of the fig tree teaches that we need not be frightened or troubled by the calamities that will come in the last days .

item.title: Preparing for the Second Coming
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches the importance of preparing for the Second Coming (D&C 45:24-59).

item.title: The Ten Virgins
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the ten virgins. Matthew 25:1-13

item.title: They that are Wise
item.description: (D&C 45:56-57) This video depicts the parable of the ten virgins, through which the Savior helps the disciples understand why and how to prepare for His Second Coming. Also included are examples of latter-day youth as they trim their spiritual lamps.

item.title: King James Version Quotes
item.description: General authorities comment on the KJV of the bible.

item.title: Zion: A Destination and a Process
item.description: Elder Hales teaches how Zion is both a destination and a process (D&C 45:64-71).

item.title: Gathering to Lands of Promise
item.description: (2 Nephi 9:1-3) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about gathering to lands of promise.

item.title: If We Teach by the Spirit
item.description: By teaching and listening by the spirit, all are edified and strengthened, individually and collectively.

item.title: Conversion Story—Linda
item.description: Linda shares how the example of her member friends led her to attend church for the first time.

item.title: The Holy Ghost Helps Us Avoid Deception
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches how the Holy Ghost helps us avoid deception (D&C 46:1-8).

item.title: Extraordinary Gift
item.description: Kuha'o, a blind 15-year-old piano prodigy, freely shares his God given musical gift to bless the lives of everyone who listens.

item.title: No Cussing Club
item.description: One boy’s crusade to encourage clean language has far-reaching effects.

item.title: Turning Hearts
item.description: A Great-Grandfather's journal helps a young man gain direction in his life and appreciation for his ancestors.

item.title: Ordinances and Covenants - The Spirit of Elijah
item.description: A young woman and her family discover the unanticipated blessings of family history work.

item.title: What is Truth? Highlight 3
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf encourages young adults and expresses the Lord's confidence in them.

item.title: Selective Obedience
item.description: Elder Pace counsels against selective obedience (D&C 49:1-14).

item.title: Peter Preaches and is Arrested
item.description: Peter and John are arrested for preaching the gospel of Jesus Christ in Jerusalem. Acts 3:12-26, 4:1-3

item.title: Man And Woman
item.description: (1 Corinthians 11:11) President Gordon B. Hinckley testifies that man and woman are God's design.

item.title: Deseret Dairy
item.description: A team manager at the Elberta dairy explains the process of producing dairy products. He emphasizes the blessing the products are to families in need and expresses the testimony he has gained by helping others.

item.title: Satan Seeks to Deceive Us
item.description: Elder Oaks admonishes how Satan seeks to deceive us (D&C 50:1-9).

item.title: Hypocrisy
item.description: (Matthew 23:23–28) An excerpt from “What Manner of Men and Women Ought Ye to Be?” Ensign or Liahona, May 2011.

item.title: A Man without Eloquence
item.description: (D&C 50:17-22) The testimony of a humble teacher helps Brigham Young become converted to the restored gospel.

item.title: Faith Lights the Way
item.description: President Hinckley teaches how faith lights the way (D&C 50:23-24).

item.title: Patterns of Light: Discerning Light
item.description: How do we recognize divine light and discern it from our own thoughts? In part 2 of this three part series, Elder David A. Bednar discusses how to discern and act upon light from God. View Part 1, Patterns of Light: The Light of Christ View Part 3, Patterns of Light: Spirit of Revelation

item.title: Honesty: You Better Believe It!
item.description: It is better to be honest than get a good score on a test.

item.title: Daily Bread: Experience
item.description: Sometimes in life, there is no where else to turn but to God. Elder D. Todd Christofferson shares a personal experience that taught him to truly pray, recognize answers to prayers, and take life one day at a time.

item.title: Michelle's Story
item.description: Local Church leaders and members strive to help the poor and needy and follow the admonition of James to "visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction" (James 1:27).

item.title: Commit to Righteousness
item.description: Elder Donald L. Hallstrom explains that to be true disciples we must receive and obey the Lord’s law.

item.title: God Will Lift Us Up
item.description: Rather than focus on her medical condition, Brittany has found comfort in serving others and trusting in the Lord.

item.title: Conversion of W. W. Phelps
item.description: This video portrays the events that led to the conversion of W. W. Phelps (D&C 55).

item.title: Need for Greatest Generation of Missionaries
item.description: (Jeremiah 16:14-16) Elder Ballard speaks on the standard of missionary service, and encourages young men to live worthily to serve missions.

item.title: The Savior Wants to Forgive
item.description: A former addict and repeat convict shares his experiences with the Savior’s ability and willingness to forgive him again and again, even when he felt undeserving.

item.title: Your Day for a Mission
item.description: At 19, Sid Going was a shoo-in for New Zealand's national rugby team, but he chose to serve a mission first. Elder Neil L. Andersen tells why Sid made the decision and how the blessings of a mission outweigh any sacrifice.

item.title: Highlight: Spiritual Whirlwinds—Neil L. Andersen
item.description: Neil L. Andersen encourages youth to trust in God during challenges and promises that they will receive the Lord's protection and guidance.

item.title: Face the Future with Faith
item.description: Quote given by Elder Russell M. Nelson in the Saturday afternoon session of general conference on April 2, 2011.

item.title: #SHAREGOODNESS
item.description: What we share reflects who we are. Are you sharing His goodness?

item.title: Practice, Celebration, Dedication: Temple Blessings in El Salvador
item.description: Share in the experience of three Latter-day Saint youth whose hopes are being realized with the dedication of El Salvador’s first temple.

item.title: My New Life
item.description: Watch and share a new Mormon Messages video, “My New Life,” to see the inspiring story of a woman who not only survived a serious accident but is now a thriving example of courage, love, and faith in Jesus Christ, through whom all is well.

item.title: Reclaimed
item.description: Elder Shayne M. Bowen teaches: "The Atonement of Jesus Christ is available to each of us. It can clean, reclaim, and sanctify even you."

item.title: Step Five: Confession
item.description: This video describes step five in the Addiction Recovery Program: Admit to yourself, to your Heavenly Father in the name of Jesus Christ, to proper priesthood authority, and to another person the exact nature of your wrongs.

item.title: Unto All The World: From World's Fair to Worldwide
item.description: Follow the brethren as they travel the world.

item.title: Obedience to Law Is Liberty
item.description: Quote given by Elder L. Tom Perry in the Sunday morning session on April 7, 2013.

item.title: "Upon My Holy Day"
item.description: (D&C 59:9-12) Elder Holland pleads with youth to keep the Sabbath day holy.

item.title: "Keep Thyself Unspotted from the World"
item.description: President Hinckley teaches how to "keep thyself unspotted from the world (D&C 59:9-14)."

item.title: Elder Hales Talks about Gratitude
item.description: Elder Hales stressed that we should never forget to thank Heavenly Father for the blessings, gifts, and talents He has given to us.

item.title: Testimony of Truth
item.description: The Lord entrusts a testimony of truth with those who share it with others. Members should be willing to share the gospel whenever they feel moved by the spirit.

item.title: Wrong Roads
item.description: When making decisions, God expects us to pray, trust, and be believing and then not give up, panic, or "jump ship" when something doesn't seem to be going right.

item.title: A Change of Heart
item.description: A young man in Honduras was drifting toward a life of apathy, selfishness, and trouble until a friend showed him he was born for so much more.

item.title: Faith Precedes the Miracle
item.description: President Monson teaches that faith precedes the miracle (D&C 35:8-11).

item.title: Watch Your Step
item.description: See how a moment’s decision can have far-reaching consequences—for good or bad.

item.title: Mountains to Climb
item.description: Finding faith in the Lord Jesus Christ will help us have the power to endure and overcome even the hardest trials in life.

item.title: Humility and Love
item.description: It is impossible to be liftin up in pride when our hearts are filled with charity.

item.title: Beware How We Take the Lord's Name
item.description: Elder Oaks warns about taking the Lord's name in vain (D&C 63:60-64).

item.title: "Required to Forgive"
item.description: W. W. Phelps tells how he was forgiven by Joseph Smith (D&C 64:9-11).

item.title: Forgiveness: My Burden Was Made Light
item.description: Forgiveness and the power of Jesus Christ enable a man to survive losing his wife and several children in a car accident—and allow the offending driver to begin rebuilding his own life.

item.title: The Heart and a Willing Mind
item.description: (D&C 64:34) Elder Heber C. Kimball and his family willingly serve the Lord as Elder Kimball leaves first from Kirtland and then from Nauvoo to preach the gospel in England.

item.title: Flecks of Gold
item.description: This compelling story of an 1850s gold prospector illustrates how giving service to others blesses our lives.

item.title: The Gospel Shall Roll Forth
item.description: A visual depiction of Church growth by stakes (D&C 65).

item.title: The Church to Fill the Earth
item.description: (D&C 65) President Hinckley reviews the prophecy of how the Church will fill the earth.

item.title: Whom the Lord Calls
item.description: (1 Samuel 10) President Monson teaches "whom the Lord calls, the Lord qualifies."

item.title: You're Never Alone
item.description: A disciple of Jesus Christ, Elaine S. Dalton, describes how a grueling marathon taught her about prayer and the strength we can receive from God.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Athlete, and Amputee who Built a Leg
item.description: Jarem Frye is a bone cancer survivor and amputee who built his own replacement leg so he could mountain bike, rock climb, water and snow skiing - he does it all. See Jarem in action at www.mormon.org/jarem

item.title: Continue in Patience
item.description: Patience requires that we obey God's commandments and faithfully wait for His will to be fulfilled.

item.title: Parents: The Prime Gospel Teachers of Their Children
item.description: Highlight of Tad R. Callister's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Maybe I'm Not So Different
item.description: Keeping a journal helps us preserve memories of seeing the Lord's hand in our lives.

item.title: Loving and Living with Differences
item.description: Highlight of Elder Dallin H. Oaks's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: The Office of Bishop
item.description: President Hinckley teaches about the office of bishop (D&C 72:9-26).

item.title: Children Are Alive in Christ
item.description: (Moroni 8:4–23) President Boyd K. Packer gave personal examples of how children are alive in Christ.

item.title: Priesthood Duty: Preaching the Gospel
item.description: A young Aaronic Priesthood holder shares the gospel with friends and neighbors through service and testimony.

item.title: The Lord Helps Us Share the Gospel
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard relates how a sister in France shares the gospel with those around her.

item.title: Sedrick’s Journey
item.description: A young boy in Africa works to earn money to serve a mission.

item.title: Patterns of Light: The Light of Christ
item.description: What is light? In this three part series, Elder David A. Bednar discusses how we receive and perceive light from God. Part 1 centers on the properties of light and how the Light of Christ affects all men and women everywhere. View Part 2, Patterns of Light: Discerning Light View Part 3, Patterns of Light: Spirit of Revelation

item.title: Spiritually Prepared
item.description: Sister Julie Beck, Relief Society general president, talks on being spiritually prepared to qualify for, receive, and act on personal revelation. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: He Lives: Testimonies of Jesus Christ
item.description: See and hear modern-day Apostles testify that Jesus Christ is the Savior and that He lives today.

item.title: War In Heaven
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley speaks about the war in heaven. Revelation 12:7-9 ("The Dawning of a Brighter Day," Ensign, May 2004)

item.title: “He Lives! All Glory to His Name!”
item.description: Elder Scott bears his testimony of the beauty and wonder of the atonement, and encourages us to ponder about and prayerfully gain knowledge of its power in our lives.

item.title: Valiant in the Testimony of Jesus
item.description: Elder Bruce R. McConkie discusses the meaning of being valiant in the testimony of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Judged by Works and Desires
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson explains that our judgment is not by chance. The kingdom of glory we receive is the result of our works and our desires.

item.title: Three Degrees of Glory
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains that the three different degrees of glory have a special relationship to the three different members of the Godhead.

item.title: No Light without Prophets
item.description: (Amos 3:3-8) Elder Mark E. Peterson explains the importance of prophets.

item.title: Godhead - He Knows Me
item.description: Two siblings in Ghana identify actions they can take to become closer to their Heavenly Father.

item.title: Becoming What Heavenly Father Desires
item.description: The final judgment is not just an evaluation of a sum total of good and evil acts—what we have done. It is an acknowledgment of the final effect of our acts and thoughts—what we have become.

item.title: In the Spirit of Thanksgiving
item.description: Random people on the streets of New York City share a variety of grateful responses to one simple question: What are you thankful for?

item.title: Priesthood Keys: The Restoration of Priesthood Keys
item.description: (1 of 4) Through the examples of ancient apostles, Elder Perry teaches how priesthood keys were restored to latter-day prophets.

item.title: Counselors
item.description: Counselors assist presidents. They have the responsibility to share their opinions, but then to support whatever decision the president makes.

item.title: Our Work Is to Go About Doing Good
item.description: (D&C 81:4-6) President Hinckley teaches that our work is to go about doing good.

item.title: “Strengthen the Feeble Knees”
item.description: Elder Marvin J. Ashton explains the meaning of Doctrine and Covenants 81:5

item.title: Succor, Lift, and Strengthen
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard relates an experience that shows how caring for each other can help us reach our full potential.

item.title: The Healing Power of Forgiveness
item.description: President James E. Faust testifies of the healing power of following the Savior’s counsel to “forgive all men” (D&C 64:10).

item.title: The Healing Power of Forgiveness
item.description: (Matthew 5:43) An excerpt from “The Healing Power of Forgiveness,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2007, 68.

item.title: The Eternal Principle of Law and Justice
item.description: (Alma 9:18–25) Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks of the great responsibility of the Saints and of what God expects of us.

item.title: Because I Have Been Given Much
item.description: With the help of a friend, a young woman in a difficult situation finds hope in the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Exceeding Great and Precious Promises
item.description: Elder Spencer J. Condie talks about the specific blessings that come from keeping the commandments of God.

item.title: Sharing the Light of Christ
item.description: Meet Brandon Jackson, who shared his time and love with orphans in Honduras and discovered what one teenage boy can do for others.

item.title: The Power of Godliness in Ordinances
item.description: Elder Octavio Tenorio describes how his family was sealed together through the power of the priesthood.

item.title: Sanctify Yourselves
item.description: When a little league football player is struck by lightning, his 18-year-old assistant coach must be prepared to use his newly conferred Melchizedek Priesthood authority to call upon the healing powers of heaven.

item.title: All That the Father Has
item.description: President Faust teaches how we can obtain all that the Father has (D&C 84:33-44).

item.title: Patterns of Light: The Light of Christ
item.description: What is light? In this three part series, Elder David A. Bednar discusses how we receive and perceive light from God. Part 1 centers on the properties of light and how the Light of Christ affects all men and women everywhere. View Part 2, Patterns of Light: Discerning Light View Part 3, Patterns of Light: Spirit of Revelation

item.title: Look to the Light
item.description: At Christmastime and always, Jesus Christ is the Light of the World for all who seek Him.

item.title: A Lifetime Pursuit
item.description: President Ezra Taft Benson testifies of the importance of building a testimony on the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Book of Mormon: Messages from Heaven
item.description: President Monson and President Erying encouraged youth to read the Book of Mormon. Youth from Eastern Europe share what they have learned from reading the Book of Mormon and writing down their impressions.

item.title: A Work of Love
item.description: A thought from Bonnie L. Oscarson, Young Women general president, about the joy of sharing the gospel with others.

item.title: Angels Round about You
item.description: Elder Holland teaches how to have angels round about you (D&C 84:86-88).

item.title: A Mighty Change: Conversion
item.description: Alejandra expresses gratitude for the changes in her life that resulted from her baptism and the joy she feels when serving others.

item.title: Jesus Declares the Parable of the Wheat and the Tares
item.description: Jesus explains the meaning of the parable of the wheat and tares. Matthew 13:36-43

item.title: Stand in Holy Places and Be Not Moved
item.description: Sister Elaine Dalton relates the story of Kristina, a young woman who joined the Church in Denmark, and encourages youth today to stand in holy places and be not moved.

item.title: Light and Truth, Part 1
item.description: This video examines God's attributes of light and truth as explained in section 88 of the Doctrine and Covenants (D&C 88:6-13).

item.title: The Spirit and the Body
item.description: President Packer teaches about the spirit and the body (D&C 88:14-17).

item.title: On the Right Road
item.description: Statement by Elder Neil L. Andersen in the Sunday afternoon session on April 1, 2012.

item.title: Christ the Creator
item.description: (Moses 2:1) Elder Maxwell testifies that Christ is the creator of our world and our savior.

item.title: He Will Draw Near to Us
item.description: Heavenly Father has given us the gospel, which teaches the way of the disciple. It teaches us the things we must know, do, and be to walk in His light, following in the footsteps of His Beloved Son, our Savior.

item.title: The Hope of God's Light
item.description: Many of us have wondered if God knows us or if He even exists. Todd was someone who wasn’t surprised when he didn’t get an immediate answer to a prayer. But could God be giving us small but obvious answers? And how patient do we need to be?

item.title: You Matter
item.description: God sees you as His child. He sees you as the being you are capable and designed to become. He wants you to know that you matter to Him.

item.title: We Teach
item.description: We teach the gospel wherever we can: at home, in sacrament meeting, in Primary, with our friends at school, and in our classes and quorum meetings. When we share our testimonies, the Holy Ghost testifies to us that what we're saying is true.

item.title: Those Warned Must Warn Others
item.description: President Eyring explains those warned must warn others (D&C 88:81-82).

item.title: Stay within the Lines
item.description: Just as athletes must stay within lines to compete in sports, those who are called to labor in the Lord's work must stay within the lines of worthiness.

item.title: The Blessings of Participation
item.description: Participation by all class members allows the Holy Ghost to enter into the heart of each learner and teach important principles.

item.title: School of the Prophets
item.description: President Hinckley teaches about the School of the Prophets (D&C 88:117-137).

item.title: Seminary Can Change Lives
item.description: A testimony is necessary to get through the difficult teenage years. President Thomas S. Monson teaches how seminary can help you build and strengthen that testimony. "Effort is required," he says. "But it is effort you will never, ever regret."

item.title: Evil Men Conspire
item.description: Satan and his emissaries will strive to entice us to use harmful substances, because they know if we partake, our spiritual powers will be inhibited and we will be in their evil power.

item.title: You Will Be Freed
item.description: Through the Atonement of Jesus Christ, all can be transformed, cleansed, and freed from addiction.

item.title: The Word of Wisdom and Revelation
item.description: The Word of Wisdom blesses us spiritually as well as physically.

item.title: A Brand New Year: Physical health
item.description: The Lord has commanded us to take good care of our bodies. This involves eating nutritious food, exercising regularly, and getting enough sleep. In this video, youth from around the world talk about staying healthy and obeying the Word of Wisdom.

item.title: The Keys of the Kingdom
item.description: President Packer teaches about the keys of the kingdom (D&C 90:1-5).

item.title: Christlike Attributes
item.description: The attributes of Christ depicted in scenes from His life.

item.title: Worshipping the Lord
item.description: We worship the Lord when we follow Him, obey His commandments, and strive to be like Him.

item.title: Light and Truth, Part 2
item.description: This video examines God's attributes of light and truth as explained in section 88 of the Doctrine and Covenants (D&C 93:28,36-40).

item.title: Proclamation Series: Children
item.description: Parents are responsible to teach children to love and serve one another and to obey the commandments.

item.title: More Diligent and Concerned at Home
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar suggests three ways each of us can become more diligent and concerned at home.

item.title: The Will of God
item.description: God uses love-inspired correction to guide us to a future we do not or cannot now envision but which He knows is the better way for us.

item.title: The Crowning Blessings of Church Membership
item.description: We have not received all the blessings of the gospel until we make receive the ordinances of the temple.

item.title: Seeing the Savior

item.title: Afflictions Can Be For Our Good
item.description: (D&C 98:1-3,11-22) Elder Oaks teaches that afflictions can be for our good.

item.description: President Faust teaches the importance of keeping covenants (Jeremiah 31:31-34).

item.title: We Must Forgive
item.description: The experience of Corrie ten Boom illustrates how we can feel the love of God when we forgive.

item.description: Elder Nelson counsels us to proclaim peace (D&C 98:16-18,23-48).

item.title: Ministry of John Taylor: Bold and Faithful Missionary
item.description: John Taylor is a successful, devoted missionary in the U.S., Canada, England, and France.

item.title: The Will of God
item.description: God uses love-inspired correction to guide us to a future we do not or cannot now envision but which He knows is the better way for us.

item.title: Finding the Incredible: What Cancer and Trials Can Teach Us

item.description: Highlight of President Henry B. Eyring's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.description: This video depicts how pride led to the apostasy of Lyman Johnson and Thomas B. Marsh (D&C 112:1-16).

Scott that "any work you do in the temple is time well spent, but receiving ordinances vicariously for one of your own ancestors will make the time in the temple more sacred." To get started finding your family members needing temple saving ordinances, visit FamilySearch.org.

item.description: The youth have been prepared to participate in temple and family history work.

item.title: "The Family is Ordained of God"
item.description: By reading "The Family: A Proclamation to the World," we can learn the importance of the family.

item.title: The Lord Communicates through Prophets
item.description: In a world full of confusion, the words of living prophets will lead the way.

item.title: Learning from General Conference
item.description: Prophets share counsel about the blessings individuals can receive through studying the messages of general conference after the conference is over. Visit gc.lds.org for details on how to access these messages.

item.title: Elevate
item.description: A short, engaging video to invite seminary students to take their learning to a higher level by meeting new graduation requirements.

item.title: Seminary Can Change Lives
item.description: A testimony is necessary to get through the difficult teenage years. President Thomas S. Monson teaches how seminary can help you build and strengthen that testimony. "Effort is required," he says. "But it is effort you will never, ever regret."

item.title: Act in Faith: The Stonemason
item.description: When a doctrine or teaching doesn't fit into the rock wall of our testimony, do we abandon the wall and walk away?

item.title: Acquiring Spiritual Knowledge: Madison’s Story
item.description: A young woman struggles with questions about plural marriage in early Church history and finds understanding as she applies principles of acquiring spiritual knowledge.

item.title: Dispensations: The Pattern of Apostasy and Restoration
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles explains dispensations of the gospel and why this last dispensation is unique.

item.title: Examining Questions with an Eternal Perspective
item.description: A young woman demonstrates the skill of reframing a difficult question in context of the Plan of Salvation.

item.title: Best Practices for Learning Assessments
item.description: Best practices for before, during, and after the seminary learning assessment. Handout is available here.

category.title: Teacher Training - Gospel Teaching and Learning Handbook Video Resources
category.subtitle: Videos: 201

item.title: An Introduction to the New Teaching and Learning Handbook
item.description: Brother Webb gives an introduction on the new Teaching and Learning Handbook and gives some instruction on its use.

item.title: Introduction-The Beginnings of Seminaries and Institutes
item.description: Elder Paul V. Johnson explains what has been and still is the expected outcome of religious education (Paul V. Johnson, "The Great Work of Seminaries and Institutes," S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2008).

item.title: 1 Great Is Your Work, and Great Are the Promises
item.description: President Eyring challenges us to turn our students to the Savior and to help them learn how they can fulfill the purposes for which they were sent to this earth (Henry B. Eyring, "To Know and to Love God," Feb. 26, 2010).

item.title: 1.1 A Strong Foundation
item.description: Elder Johnson challenges teachers to strive to accomplish the S&I Objective in an effort to help students build a strong spiritual foundation (Paul V. Johnson, "A Pattern for Learning Spiritual Things," Aug. 2012).

item.title: 1.1 Covenants
item.description: Sister Beck explains the eternal value of covenants (Julie B. Beck, "Teaching the Doctrine of the Family" S&I Aug. Broadcast, Aug. 2009).

item.title: 1.1 Our Call to Teach Eternal Truth
item.description: President Eyring reminds us that our call has always been to teach eternal truth in a way that will help our students choose to love Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ (Henry B. Eyring, "To Know and to Love God," Feb. 26, 2010).

item.title: 1.1 Preparing the Rising Generation
item.description: Elder Paul Johnson emphasizes the need for teachers to do more to help students prepare spiritually for the challenges they are facing (Paul V. Johnson, "Preparing the Rising Generation," Address to Religious Educators, Jan 28, 2011).

item.title: 1.1 Remembering the Objective
item.description: Elder Nelson encourages us to remember the Objective of Seminaries and Institutes every day before we teach (Russell M. Nelson, "Teaching Youth in the Day of the Wave," S&I August Broadcast, 2013).

item.title: 1.1 We Must Be Reaching Their Minds, Hearts, and Souls
item.description: Elder Kerr helps us understand our role as catalysts to the Lord's process of opening and preparing the minds and hearts of students to receive and embrace the gospel message (W. Rolfe Kerr, "Touching the Minds and Hearts of Youth," Feb. 4, 2005).

item.title: 1.2.1 A Teacher's Influence by Living the Gospel
item.description: Elder Bednar tells about his seminary teacher and how his righteous example left a lasting impression on him (David A. Bednar, The Doctrine and Covenants-Welcome to Seminary DVD).

item.title: 1.2.1 Influencing Students Through Who We Are as Teachers
item.description: President Uctdorf reminds us that our students are influenced by our testimony, faith, example, and love (Dieter F. Ucthdorf, "A Teacher of God's Children," Address to Religious Educators, Jan 28, 2011).

item.title: 1.2.1 Living the Gospel
item.description: Elder Ballard leads a discussion on the importance of living the gospel so that we can teach with power (Discussion with M. Russell Ballard, Paul V. Johnson, and Chad H. Webb, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2010).

item.title: 1.2.1 Our Constant Companion
item.description: Elder Eyring emphasizes that teachers must have the spirit as their constant companion in order to teach with power (Henry B. Eyring, 'The Spirit Must Be our Constant Companion,' Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 7, 2003).

item.title: 1.2.1 The Holy Ghost is the Teacher
item.description: Elder Ballard teaches that we need to live worthy so that the Holy Ghost may be in our classes and do the teaching (M. Russell Ballard, "We Are on the Lord's Errand," S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2010).

item.title: 1.2.1 The Power of Examples
item.description: Elder Bednar tells about his seminary teacher and how his righteous example left a lasting impression on him (David A. Bednar, The Doctrine and Covenants-Welcome to Seminary DVD).

item.title: 1.2.2 Be Brilliant in the Basics
item.description: Sister Beck encourages us to set a great example for our students by having an exemplary marriage (Julie B. Beck, "Teaching the Doctrine of the Family" S&I Aug. Broadcast, Aug. 2009).

item.title: 1.2.2 Living the Gospel
item.description: Elder Nelson emphasizes the importance of setting a Christlike example in our marriage and in our home because it will leave an eternal impact on your student's hearts and minds (Russell M. Nelson, "Teaching Youth in the Day of the Wave," 2013).

item.title: 1.2.2 Our Conduct in the Home
item.description: Sister Burton shares what her father taught her about the lessons he learned when he taught early morning seminary (Linda K. Burton, "Home, a Glimpse of Heaven," S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2013).

item.title: 1.2.2 Spouse Support
item.description: Elder Ballard explains the importance of spouses supporting and loving each other through daily prayer (Discussion with M. Russell Ballard, Paul V. Johnson, and Chad H. Webb, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2010).

item.title: 1.2.2 The Influence of a Teacher's Example
item.description: President Hinckley encourages teachers to be a worthy example to their students in all aspects of their lives. (Gordon B. Hinckley, 'A Challenging Time, A Wonderful Time,' Address to Religious Educators, Feb 7, 2003)

item.title: 1.2.3 Continually Seek to Improve
item.description: Brother Hawks shares a video clip where Elder Jeffrey R. Holland challenges us to continually seek to improve throughout our career and throughout our lives (Richard D. Hawks, "We Continually Seek to Improve," S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2014).

item.title: 1.3.1 Keeping the Gospel Simple
item.description: Elder Ballard encourages us to teach with simplicity, using the scriptures and the words of the prophets (M. Russell Ballard, "We Are on the Lord's Errand," S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2010).

item.title: 1.3.1 Study and Ponder General Conference
item.description: President Monson encourages us to read, ponder, and apply the teachings of the words of the prophets (Thomas S. Monson, “God be with you Til we meet again” General Conference, Oct. 2012).

item.title: 1.3.1 The Scriptures and the Words of the Prophets
item.description: Brother Webb challenges us to teach the scriptures & the words of the prophets; as we focus on the small things, great things will be brought to pass in the lives of our students (Chad Webb, "An Invitation to Study the Doctrine and Covenants," 2014).

item.title: 1.3.1 Tuning Our Ears to Prophetic Priorities
item.description: Brother Haws addresses S&I personnel and exhorts them to harmonize their efforts with prophetic priorities and the direction of those appointed to lead us (R. Kelly Haws, "Tuning Our Ears to Prophetic Priorities and Direction," S&I Inservice, 2013).

item.title: 1.3.1 Words of the Prophets
item.description: Elder Anderson shares an example of how a teacher links the scriptures to the words of the prophets and by doing so will bring faith and assurance to our youth (Neil L. Andersen, "A Classroom of Faith, Hope, and Charity," Feb. 28, 2014).

item.title: 1.3.3 Enabled to Share the Gospel
item.description: A seminary teacher and student share personal experiences about the role of seminary in helping them be prepared to answer questions to others not of our faith (Welcome to Seminary DVD Elder Oaks--The Old Testament 'An Introduction to Seminary').

item.title: 1.3.3 Help Students to Fulfill Their Role
item.description: Brother Webb instructs us on the importance of encouraging our students to participate in order to help them become good learners (Chad H. Webb, "Deepening Conversion," S&I Aug. Broadcast, Aug. 2007).

item.title: 1.3.3 Helping Students Inquire of the Lord
item.description: Elder Eyring speaks of the importance of students learning to inquire of the Lord through prayer (Henry B. Eyring, 'Inquire of the Lord,' Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 2, 2001).

item.title: 1.3.3 Helping a Friend
item.description: A young woman shares an experience with Elder Ballard about when she had the opportunity to influence a friend by sharing a gospel teaching with her (Welcome to Seminary DVD, Elder Ballard--The New Testament, "An Apostle's Invitation").

item.title: 1.3.3 Let them Find the Answers
item.description: Sister Elaine S. Dalton explains the importance of letting the students find the answers to their questions.(Teaching and Learning Panel, Randall L. Hall, Kim B. Clark, President, Elaine S. Dalton, Richard I. Heaton, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2009)

item.title: 1.3.3 Making Seminary Great
item.description: Elder Bednar teaches the youth the importance of using their agency by acting in a way that invites the Holy Ghost into their classroom expereince (David A. Bednar, The Doctrine and Covenants-Welcome to Seminary DVD).

item.title: 1.3.3 More Than Saving Themselves
item.description: Elder Hales shares the importance of teaching our youth that along with their own conversion, they have a responsibility to help others achieve exaltation as well (Robert D. Hales, 'Teaching by Faith,' Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 1, 2002).

item.title: 1.3.3 Preparing Future Parents
item.description: Elder Scott helps teachers see how the gospel is carried from one generation to the next as students become converted and prepared to pass on to their children the truths of the gospel (Richard G. Scott, 'To Live and Understand Truth,' Feb 4, 2005).

item.title: 1.3.3 Preparing the Youth for Their Missions
item.description: Elder Ballard leads a discussion on helping the youth to be better prepared to teach the gospel to others (Discussion with M. Russell Ballard, Paul V. Johnson, and Chad H. Webb, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2010).

item.title: 1.3.3 Seek Learning By Faith
item.description: Elder Bednar teaches about faith and how individuals can exercise faith in learning, and the resulting implications for teachers. (David A. Bednar, "Seek Learning by Faith," Address to Religious Educators, Feb 3, 2006)

item.title: 1.3.3 Spiritual Learning Requires Effort
item.description: Elder Bednar teaches the youth the importance of using their agency by acting in a way that invites the Holy Ghost into their classroom expereince (David A. Bednar, The Doctrine and Covenants-Welcome to Seminary DVD).

item.title: 1.4.2 A Parenting Team
item.description: Elder Hales reminds us that our goal needs to be one of unity and cooperation, not competition with the parents and priesthood leaders that we assist (Robert D. Hales, 'Teaching by Faith,' Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 1, 2002).

item.title: 1.4.3 A Junior Partner
item.description: Elder Maxwell encourages Seminary and Institute personnel to give special deference to family and priesthood leaders as they all work together for the welfare of the students (Neal A. Maxwell, 'Glorify Christ,' Feb. 2, 2001).

item.title: 1.4.3 Enrolling and Retaining Students
item.description: Elder Oaks and a panel discuss ways of reaching more students and retaining them (A Panel Discussion with Elder Dallin H. Oaks--Creating Unity,Seminary and Institute, Aug. Broadcast, 2012).

item.title: 1.4.3 Equally yoked
item.description: Brother Beck invites us to work closely with priesthood leaders and help young men fulfill their Duty to God (David L. Beck, Helping Young Men Fulfill Their Duty to God, S&I Aug. Broadcast).

item.title: 1.4.3 Invite One More to Enroll
item.description: Elder Ballard teaches the parable of the Lost Sheep to a group of youth and challenges each of them to invite and enroll one more person into seminary (Welcome to Seminary DVD, Elder Ballard--The New Testament, 'An Apostle's Invitation').

item.title: 1.4.3 Inviting Students
item.description: Brother Moore teaches about our responsibility in the enrolling process (Gary Moore, Enrolling, Teaching, and Empowering the "One," S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2008).

item.title: 1.4.3 Linking Arms with other organizations
item.description: Elder Paul V. Johnson explains his feelings about working with other auxiliaries to help bless the youth (Paul V. Johnson, S&I Aug. Broadcast 2010).

item.title: 1.4.3 Supporting Church Youth Achievement Programs
item.description: Elder Hales invites us to consider the results our efforts would produce as we support our students in their efforts with Duty to God, Personal Progress, and For the Strength of Youth, etc. (Robert D. Hales, 'Teaching by Faith,' Feb. 1, 2002).

item.title: 1.4.3 Working with Priesthood Leaders to Enroll More Youth
item.description: Elder Ballard and Elder Johnson share ideas on how to work well with priesthood leaders (Discussion with M. Russell Ballard, Paul V. Johnson, and Chad H. Webb, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2010).

item.title: 1.4.3. Working Together With Priesthood Leaders
item.description: Elder Nelson exhorts us to reach out by working closely with priesthood leaders in order to rescue the youth of the church (Russell M. Nelson, "Teaching Youth in the Day of the Wave," S&I August Broadcast, 2013).

item.title: Equally Yoked Together
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer uses the story of oxen being equally yoked together to teach principles of teamwork.

item.title: Help Us Discover the Gospel
item.description: Leaders and teachers follow the Savior by helping youth discover the gospel for themselves. They don't just talk. They listen carefully, ask questions, and help youth participate actively.

item.title: Lead Us to Conversion
item.description: Your purpose as a leader is to help youth become deeply converted to the gospel of Jesus Christ. As their hearts change, you’ll see them become unified, share the gospel with others, and repent of their sins.

item.title: Strengthen Our Families
item.description: If the youth learn and teach the gospel with their families the way they do with their leaders, they'll have powerful experiences that they couldn't have any other way.

item.title: We Act
item.description: If the youth are going to become converted, they can't just listen. They have to act on what they're learning.

item.title: We Become
item.description: If you help the youth feel the love, peace, and forgiveness that come from the Atonement, they will become truly converted.

item.title: We Learn
item.description: The Lord is inviting us to become converted to His gospel right now while we're young. We learn and grow when we prepare ourselves, work together, and seek the guidance of the Holy Ghost.

category.title: 2 - Fundamentals of Gospel Teaching and Learning
category.subtitle: Videos: 54

item.title: 2 Incorporating the Fundamentals
item.description: Elder Nelson reminds us to teach the Fundamentals of Gospel Teaching & Learning as found in the Gospel Teaching & Learning Handbook so we can prepare our youth for missionary service (Russell M. Nelson, "Teaching Youth in the Day of the Wave," 2013).

item.title: 2.1 Allow students to receive revelation
item.description: Elder Oaks explains how important it is that we help, but not force our students to have an experience with the Spirit (A Panel Discussion with Elder Dallin H. Oaks--Creating Unity,Seminary and Institute, Aug. Broadcast, 2012).

item.title: 2.1 Do I Teach the Gospel by the Spirit of Truth?
item.description: President Uctdorf emphasizes that without the spirit, no eternal learning can take place. (Dieter F. Ucthdorf, "A Teacher of God's Children," Address to Religious Educators, Jan 28, 2011.)

item.title: 2.1 Inviting the Holy Ghost
item.description: Brother Webb challenges us to identify and implement ways of inviting the Holy Ghost into the learning expereince more often and with more power (Chad H. Webb, "Deepening Conversion," S&I Aug. Broadcast, Aug. 2007).

item.title: 2.1 Practices that Invite the Holy Ghost
item.description: Brother Webb shares many ways to invite the Holy Ghost into the learning experience and if we do them our students will have peace, healing, and the guidance that they need (Chad H. Webb, "Deepening Conversion," S&I Aug. Broadcast, Aug. 2007).

item.title: 2.1 Secular and Spiritual Learning
item.description: Elder Johnson explains the differences between secular and spiritual learning and reminds us that gospel teaching and learning takes place only through the power of the Holy Ghost (Paul V. Johnson, "A Pattern for Learning Spiritual Things" Aug 2012).

item.title: 2.2 Two Examples of Charity
item.description: Elder Anderson tells about two teachers that were examples of Christlike love and how their love greatly Influenced their students (Neil L. Andersen, "A Classroom of Faith, Hope, and Charity," Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 28, 2014).

item.title: 2.2 Unity and Love
item.description: Elder Oaks leads a discussion about the importance of cultivating a learning environment of love, respect, and purpose (A Panel Discussion with Elder Dallin H. Oaks--Creating Unity,Seminary and Institute, Aug. Broadcast, 2012).

item.title: 2.2.1 Establishing Bonds of Charity
item.description: A panel discusses the importance of creating a safe classroom environment where students feel comfortable sharing (Teaching and Learning Panel, Randall L. Hall, Kim B. Clark, Elaine S. Dalton, Richard I. Heaton, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2009).

item.title: 2.2.1 Loving Your Students
item.description: Elder Ballard explains that we should express love to our students (M. Russell Ballard, "We Are on the Lord's Errand," S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2010).

item.title: 2.2.1 The Divine Influence of Love
item.description: President Uctdorf shares a personal story of how some seminary students in Germany were greatly influenced by the sincere love of their teacher, Sister Dora Dieter (Dieter F. Ucthdorf, "A Teacher of God's Children," Jan. 28, 2011).

item.title: 2.2.1 Understanding Student Needs
item.description: Elder Hales emphasises the importance of teachers understanding the needs, learning abilities, and concerns that our students are facing (Robert D. Hales, 'Teaching by Faith,' Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 1, 2002).

item.title: 2.2.1 We must sincerly love and trust our students.
item.description: Brother Chad Webb encourages us to examine our feelings towards our students, remembering that love softens hearts and invites the Holy Ghost. (Chad H. Webb, "Deepening Conversion," S&I Aug. Broadcast, Aug. 2007).

item.title: 2.2.2 Expecting More from Your Students
item.description: Sister Oscarson shares a personal experience about a seminary teacher that had high expectaions for her and how those high expectations blessed her life (Bonnie L. Oscarson, "Greater Expectations," S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2014).

item.title: 2.2.2 Setting High Expectation
item.description: Kim B. Clark shares his feelings about the importance of having high expectations for the students (Teaching and Learning Panel, Randall L. Hall, Kim B. Clark, Elaine S. Dalton, Richard I. Heaton, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2009).

item.title: 2.3.1 A Marking System that Works for You
item.description: Elder Bednar exhorts the youth to find a marking system that works for them so that they can capture and retain the things they learn and feel (David A. Bednar, The Doctrine and Covenants-Welcome to Seminary DVD).

item.title: 2.3.1 Asking, Seeking, and Knocking
item.description: Elder Bednar teaches the importance of asking questions and seeking for answers as we look to the Lord for personal revelation (David A. Bednar, The Doctrine and Covenant-Welcome to Seminary DVD).

item.title: 2.3.1 Challenges and Blessings
item.description: Elder Oaks guides a discussion with students that helps them see a variety of approaches in developing the habit of daily scripture study (Welcome to Seminary DVD Elder Oaks--The Old Testament 'An Introduction to Seminary').

item.title: 2.3.1 I Love My Daily Scripture Study
item.description: Elder Oaks describes the blessings of daily scripture study and urges teachers and students to begin each study session with a prayer for specific guidance. (Welcome to Seminary DVD Elder Oaks--The Old Testament 'Welcome to Seminary')

item.title: 2.3.1 Meaningful Scripture Study
item.description: Elder Oaks leads a panel discussion about improving and encouraging our student's scripture study (A Panel Discussion with Elder Dallin H. Oaks--Creating Unity,Seminary and Institute, Aug. Broadcast, 2012).

item.title: 2.3.1 Pondering and Prayer in Scripture Study
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches the importance of pondering and prayer during scripture study (Welcome to Seminary DVD Elder Oaks--The Old Testament).

item.title: 2.3.1 The Scriptures are a Fountain of Living Water
item.description: Kim B. Clark discusses how important the role of the teacher is in helping the scriptures come to life for the students (Teaching and Learning Panel, Randall L. Hall, Kim B. Clark, Elaine S. Dalton, Richard I. Heaton, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2009).

item.title: 2.3.1 Visualizing David and Goliath
item.description: A seminary student describes the way he visualizes David and Goliath and how it helps him learn from the account (Welcome to Seminary DVD, Dallin H. Oaks--The Old Testament, "The Faith of David").

item.title: 2.4 The Tenth Leper
item.description: Elder Ballard explains the principle of gratitude by teaching the story of Christ healing the ten lepers (Welcome to Seminary DVD, Elder Ballard--The New Testament, "An Apostle's Invitation").

item.title: 2.4.1 Born Again
item.description: Elder Ballard helps a group of students understand the context of the story of Nicodemus (Welcome to Seminary DVD, Elder Ballard--The New Testament, "An Apostle's Invitation").

item.title: 2.5 Helping Students Understand, Retain, and Use Divine Truth
item.description: Elder Scott expresses the concern that students are not living the gospel principles they are learning; he urges teachers to help students to understand and apply the gospel in their lives (Richard G. Scott, "To Live and Understand Truth," Feb 4, 20)

item.title: 2.5.1 Being True to the Scriptures
item.description: Brother Webb explains that if we want to teach with more power, then we need to help our students to understand the doctrine and principles in the scriptures (Chad H. Webb, "Deepening Conversion," S&I Aug. Broadcast, Aug. 2007).

item.title: 2.5.1 Look for Principles
item.description: Elder Oaks leads a discussion with seminary students about the importance of discovering and applying principles from the scriptures to benefit their personal life (Welcome to Seminary DVD, Dallin H. Oaks--The Old Testament, "The Faith of David").

item.title: 2.5.3 Feeling leads to application
item.description: Elder Ballard teaches the importance of students internalizing the gospel through the feelings in their hearts (Discussion with M. Russell Ballard, Paul V. Johnson, and Chad H. Webb, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2010).

item.title: 2.5.4 It Is Not Enough to Know
item.description: Elder Hales stresses the point that it is not enough for our students to simply know the gospel; they must apply gospel principles in their daily lives (Robert D. Hales, 'Teaching by Faith,' Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 1, 2002).

item.title: 2.5.4 The Importance and Power of Pondering
item.description: Elder Hales invites teachers to provide time in class for students to ponder, write down their thoughts and impressions as well as exchange ideas that will lead to practical application (Robert D. Hales, 'Teaching by Faith,' Feb 1, 2002).

item.title: 2.5.4 The word needs to be internalized
item.description: Elder Johnson explains how important it is for teachers to help students apply gospel principles (Discussion with M. Russell Ballard, Paul V. Johnson, and Chad H. Webb, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2010).

item.title: 2.5.4 This is how you Live the Gospel
item.description: Kim B. Clark shares his feeling about teaching the stories in the scriptures so that our students will know how to live the gospel (Teaching and Learning Panel, Randall Hall, Kim B. Clark, Elaine S. Dalton, Richard Heaton, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2009).

item.title: 2.6 Faith-Promoting Incidents
item.description: Elder Hales teaches us that when students fulfill their role of teaching and testifying to their peers then faith promoting incidents occur (Robert D. Hales, 'Teaching by Faith,' Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 1, 2002).

item.title: 2.6 Learning by Teaching
item.description: Elder Ballard helps us to understand that a person usually learns more when they are teaching the gospel to others (Welcome to Seminary DVD, Elder Ballard--The New Testament, "An Apostle's Invitation").

item.title: 2.6 Preparing the Students to Share
item.description: Elder Johnson shares a concern from mission presidents that the youth have testimonies, but they are not able to share them (Discussion with M. Russell Ballard, Paul V. Johnson, and Chad H. Webb, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2010).

item.title: 2.6 Providing Teaching Opportunities for Students
item.description: Elder Scott offers a specific, four-step outline to serve as a framework for students to use in preparing brief speaking assignments or presentations of gospel messages (Richard G. Scott, "To Live and Understand Truth," Feb. 4, 2005).

item.title: 2.6 Seminary can prepare future Missionaries
item.description: Richard I. Heaton shares some valuable council about how to help our youth prepare for effective missionary service (Teaching and Learning Panel, Randall Hall, Kim B. Clark, President, Elaine S. Dalton, Richard I. Heaton, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2009).

item.title: 2.6 The Value of Sharing the Gospel
item.description: Brother Richard I. Heaton shares some ideas about our desire to share the gospel after it has touched us. (Teaching and Learning Panel, Randall L. Hall, Kim B. Clark, President, Elaine S. Dalton, Richard I. Heaton, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2009)

item.title: 2.6.3 Bearing Testimony
item.description: A panel discusses the importance of bearing testimony during class so that the Holy Ghost can touch the hearts of the students (Randall L. Hall, Kim B. Clark, Elaine S. Dalton, Richard I. Heaton, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2009).

item.title: 2.6.3 The Teacher Who Bears Testimony
item.description: President Uctdorf speaks of the potential a teacher's testimony has of touching the hearts and minds of the students. (Dieter F. Ucthdorf, "A Teacher of God's Children," Address to Religious Educators, Jan 28, 2011.)

item.title: 2.7 Analyzing a Passage
item.description: Seminary students seek to understand the doctrine taught in the scripture mastery passage found in Moroni 7:41, by engaging in an in-depth study together in class.

item.title: 2.7 A Student Centered Discussion
item.description: By asking effective questions a teacher helps his students to identify, understand, feel the truth and importance of, and apply the basic doctrines found in the scripture mastery passage Moroni 10:4-5.

item.title: 2.7 Blessing Students Worldwide
item.description: Several Institute students testify of when the basic doctrines in scripture mastery passages have blessed their life and given them strength in times of need.

item.title: 2.7 Preparing Future Missionaries
item.description: Elder Nelson challenges us to teach the scripture mastery verses and doctrine together in order help our students be more prepared for their missionary service (Russell M. Nelson, "Teaching Youth in the Day of the Wave," S&I August Broadcast, 2013).

item.title: 2.7 Receiving Needed Help
item.description: Several seminary students share how basic doctrines in the scripture mastery passages have helped them in times of need as well as in missionary opportunities.

item.title: 2.7.2 Centered in the Doctrine
item.description: Elder Anderson exhorts us to keep our teaching centered in the doctrine of Christ (Neil L. Andersen, "A Classroom of Faith, Hope, and Charity," Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 28, 2014).

item.title: 2.7.2 The Importance of the Basic Doctrines
item.description: Brother Webb testifies of the importance of not over looking the Basic Doctrines in our teachings (Chad Webb, "An Invitation to Study the Doctrine and Covenants," S&I August Broadcast 2014).

item.title: 2.7.2 Teaching the Doctrine of the Family
item.description: Sister Beck teaches the importance of the family in God's plan (Julie B. Beck, "Teaching the Doctrine of the Family" S&I Aug. Broadcast, Aug. 2009).

item.title: Invite Us to Act
item.description: If youth act on what you teach, they’ll experience the gospel for themselves. Your encouragement and invitations to act can lead them to conversion.

item.title: Invite Us to Testify
item.description: It's important to help the youth share their testimonies by using questions and inviting them personally.

item.title: Let Us Teach
item.description: Whenever and wherever the youth teach, they share their thoughts, experiences, and testimonies to help others become converted.

item.title: Know and Love Us
item.description: When the youth feel you really love them, you'll be able to help them become converted to the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: We Share
item.description: To really become converted, we've got to talk about what we're learning. When we share our thoughts, feelings, and experiences, we feel the Holy Ghost. That strengthens us, and our friends, too.

category.title: 3 - Teaching the Scriptures in Seminaries and Institutes of Religion
category.subtitle: Videos: 7

item.title: 3 Scripture Centered Teaching
item.description: Brother Webb reminds us we are commissioned to teach the scriptures and that the scriptures need to be the center of our teaching (Chad Webb, "An Invitation to Study the Doctrine and Covenants," S&I August Broadcast 2014).

item.title: 3 Sequential Scripture Teaching
item.description: Elder Johnson teaches the history of sequential scripture teaching and how it has blessed Seminaries and Institutes (Paul V. Johnson, "Follow the Lord's Path," S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2005).

item.title: Luke 5:1-11—A Class Model
item.description: A teacher leads his class through the study of Luke 5:1-11 as suggested in the example.

item.title: Luke 5:12-26—A Class Model
item.description: A teacher leads his class through the study of Luke 5:12-26 as suggested in the example.

item.title: Luke 5:36-39—A Class Model
item.description: A teacher leads his class through the study of Luke 5:36-39 as suggested in the example.

item.title: Use the Scriptures
item.description: As you help the youth study and apply the scriptures in class, they'll want to study and apply them on their own at home.

item.title: The Importance of the Seminary and Institute Curriculum
item.description: Explanation of the importance of the curriculum used in Seminaries and Institutes.

item.title: 4.1 Teacher Preparation
item.description: Brother Webb reminds us of what we need to do in our personal preparation so that we can invite the the Holy Ghost to bless us and to bless our students (Chad H. Webb, "Deepening Conversion," S&I Aug. Broadcast, Aug. 2007).

item.title: 4.1.2 The Power of Praying for a Child of God
item.description: "President Eyring shares a personal experience he had while serving as an early morning seminary teacher and a lesson he learned about praying for students on an individual basis (Henry B. Eyring, ""To Know and to Love God,"" Feb. 26, 2010). "

item.title: 4.1.3 Every Student is Precious
item.description: Elder Ballard bears testimony that the youth are precious and that they are all sons and daughters of God (M. Russell Ballard, "We Are on the Lord's Errand," S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2010).

item.title: 4.1.3 Faithful Expectations
item.description: Brother Webb exhorts us to trust in our students because what a teacher believes about their students has a significant impact on the spirit in a classroom (Chad H. Webb, "Deepening Conversion," S&I Aug. Broadcast, Aug. 2007).

item.title: 4.1.3 Seeing Students as They Really Are
item.description: President Uctdorf shares a personal story of how a Bishop's faith in a difficult group of young men, helped to transform them into faithful Latter-day Saints (Dieter F. Ucthdorf, "A Teacher of God's Children," Jan. 28, 2011).

item.title: 4.1.3 Spiritually Sensitive Students
item.description: Elder Anderson reminds us that the Lord has reserved the youth for our day to fight against Satan and to build up Zion (Neil L. Andersen, "A Classroom of Faith, Hope, and Charity," Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 28, 2014).

item.title: 4.1.3 The Lord Knows Every Need
item.description: Elder Scott assures us that the Lord knows the needs of every student and that if we follow the spirit as we prepare and teach, He will help meet those needs through divine inspiration (Richard G. Scott, "To Live and Understand Truth," Feb. 4, 2005).

item.title: 4.1.3 The Lord Will Qualify You for This Work
item.description: President Uctdorf acknowledges the feelings of inadquecy teachers may often have, but promises that the Lord's blessings are upon those who are about His work (Dieter F. Ucthdorf, "A Teacher of God's Children," Jan. 28, 2011).

item.title: 4.1.3 Trusting in the Scriptures
item.description: Brother Webb teaches about an experience when he did not show his students that he trusted in the scriptures and he shares the valuable lesson that he learned (Chad Webb, "An Invitation to Study the Doctrine and Covenants," S&I Aug. Broadcast 2014).

item.title: 4.2 Preparing the Students to learn
item.description: Brother Chad Webb shares some ideas about training and preparing the students to be ready for spiritual learning (A Panel Discussion with Elder Dallin H. Oaks--Creating Unity,Seminary and Institute, Aug. Broadcast, 2012).

item.title: 4.2 When Teachers and Students Join in Prayer and Faith
item.description: President Eyring shares an experience he had while teaching a class that illustrates the powerful spiritual experiences teachers and students can have in class when they are all prepared (Henry B. Eyring, "To Know and to Love God," Feb. 26, 2010).

item.title: 4.3.1 Following the Curriculum; An Example
item.description: An instructor and his students study Alma 7 following the lesson outline suggested in the Book of Mormon Seminary Teacher Manual (You may find it helpful to review Lesson 73, Alma 6-7 before viewing the video example).

item.title: 4.3.4 Teaching Students, Not Lessons
item.description: Elder Anderson tells a story about a teacher that was not concerened about following a prescribed lesson plan, but rather focusing on the conversion of their students (Neil L. Andersen, "A Classroom of Faith, Hope, and Charity," Feb. 28, 2014).

item.title: 4.3.1 We Must Teach the Gospel In Its Simple Purity
item.description: President Eyring warns against specualtion and personal interpretation as we teach the gospel.(Henry B. Eyring, "To Know and to Love God," Address to Religious Educators, Feb 26, 2010)

item.title: 4.3.4 Assuring Abundant Student Participation
item.description: Elder Scott affirms the importance of students participating in learning and teaches that their participation authorizes the Holy Ghost to be a part of their learning experience (Richard G. Scott, "To Live and Understand Truth," Feb. 4, 2005).

item.title: 4.3.4 Decide through inspiration
item.description: Elder Oaks explains how important it is that we follow the promptings of the Spirit when we prepare our lessons and not just go off personal preference (A Panel Discussion with Elder Dallin H. Oaks, S&I August Broadcast, 2012).

item.title: Seminary Curriculum Introduction 2013
item.description: An introduction to the 2013 seminary curriculum.

item.title: 4.3.4 Involving Students
item.description: Brother Garry Moore explains that students learn best when they are involved.

item.title: An Introduction to the New Teaching and Learning Handbook
item.description: Brother Webb gives an introduction on the new Teaching and Learning Handbook and gives some instruction on its use.

item.title: 5.1 Requiring Students to Think
item.description: Elder Hales models for us a series of questions that will invite our students to think as well as feel the importance of and apply what they have been taught (Robert D. Hales, 'Teaching by Faith,' Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 1, 2002).

item.title: 5.1 Stimulating Student Thought
item.description: Elder Scott challenges teachers to stimulate students to think by asking clear and carefully formulated questions. (Richard G. Scott, 'To Live and Understand Truth,' Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 4, 2005).

item.title: 5.1.3 Asking Good Questions
item.description: Brother Webb teaches that good questions are simple yet powerful ways to invite the Holy Ghost to witness to our students (Chad H. Webb, "Deepening Conversion," S&I Aug. Broadcast, Aug. 2007).

item.title: 5.2 Interacting with students
item.description: Brother Chad Webb shares counsel on how to led an effective class discussion (A Panel Discussion with Elder Dallin H. Oaks--Creating Unity,Seminary and Institute, Aug. Broadcast, 2012).

item.title: 5.2 Meaningful Class Discussions
item.description: Elder Anderson explains several ways that we can help the youth to gain spiritual understanding (Neil L. Andersen, "A Classroom of Faith, Hope, and Charity," Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 28, 2014).

item.title: 5.5 The Good Shepherd
item.description: Elder Ballard shares a personal story to help to a group of students understand a principle in the sciptures better (Welcome to Seminary DVD, Elder Ballard--The New Testament, "An Apostle's Invitation").

item.title: 5.9 Effective Visual Aids
item.description: Elder Scott teaches how the use of appealing visual aids helps students to capture critical concepts and to understand important gospel truths (Richard G. Scott, "To Live and Understand Truth," Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 4, 2005).

item.title: 5.12 A Caution
item.description: Elder Johnson shares a personal experience to teach the principle that we need to have pure motives in order to bless the lives of our students (Paul V. Johnson, "Teaching with Righteous Principles," S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2014).

item.title: 5.12 Eye Single to God's Glory
item.description: Brother Webb reminds us we are teaching Heavenly Father’s children and we must be motivated solely by a desire to bless them and not by any personal recognition or gain (Chad H. Webb, "Not My Will But Thine," S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2009).

item.title: 5.12 Keeping the Savior as the Focus of our Service
item.description: President Uctdorf warns teachers against pride and creating their own followers; he encourages them to inspire their students to follow the Savior (Dieter F. Ucthdorf, "A Teacher of God's Children," Address to Religious Educators, Jan 28, 2011).

item.title: 5.12 One of the Greatest Mistakes
item.description: Elder Hales warns teachers not to turn the students to themselves; he urges the teachers to turn the students to the Lord. (Robert D. Hales, 'Teaching by Faith,' Address to Religious Educators, Feb. 1, 2002).

item.title: Best Practices for Learning Assessments
item.description: Best practices for before, during, and after the seminary learning assessment. Handout is available here.

item.title: Ask Us Questions
item.description: Asking youth the right questions helps them think deeply about the gospel. As they search their hearts for answers, the Holy Ghost helps them learn what they need individually.

item.title: Share Stories and Examples
item.description: When the youth share their experiences, and leaders share theirs, the Holy Ghost is invited into the class and testifies of truth.

category.title: 6 - Continuing to Improve as a Teacher
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: 6 Continuing to Improve
item.description: Elder Johnson teaches the importance of continually seeking to improve and receive correction (Paul V. Johnson, "Counsel and Correction," S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2004).

item.description: Seminary students seek to understand the doctrine taught in the scripture mastery passage found in Moroni 7:41, by engaging in an in-depth study together in class.

item.title: 2.7 A Student Centered Discussion
item.description: By asking effective questions a teacher helps his students to identify, understand, feel the truth and importance of, and apply the basic doctrines found in the scripture mastery passage Moroni 10:4-5.
